loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia MARTHA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.  La ciudad de Calca esta una hora de la provincia de Cusco.
  
La socia tiene 65 años de edad es viuda y tiene cuatro hijas mujeres. 

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de sus hijas y con el trabajo. Ella trabaja vendiendo comida en el mercado modelo de Calca.    

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de comida.     
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. She is from the Calca province in the Cusco department. Calca is one hour from the Cusco province. She is a 65 year old widow, and she has four daughters. She alternates her activities between taking care of her daughters and work. She works selling food in the Modelo Market in Calca. She needs a loan to increase capital in her business of selling food. She is grateful for the opportunity that is offered, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital in her business of selling food

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose tiene 19 años de edad.  Vive con su cónyuge que támbien es una persona joven. Tiene una hija de 1 año.  Ellos viven en la casa de su suegra.  Ellos se dedican al reciclaje.  Su cónyuge tiene un pequeño negocio de la crianza de cerdos.  Tiene 1 cerda madre y 3 cerdos pequeños que su madre le obsequió.  Esta actividad la vienen ejerciendo hace 1 año.  Jose tiene muchos objetivos, uno de ellos es incrementar la crianza de cerdos ya que es un negocio muy rentable.  Su suegra la apoya.  Es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito por recomendación de su suegra  que también es clienta de la Caja Rural.  Con el dinero que solicita desea dedicarse támbien a la venda de sandía como ambulante ya que anteriormente se dedicaron a esta actividad.
texts.en:
Jose is 19 years old and lives with his wife, who is also young. He has a 1 year old daughter. They live in his mother-in-law’s house, and work in recycling. His wife also has a small pig-raising business. She has one mother sow and three piglets that her mother gave her. They have been working in this business for one year.

Jose has many goals, one of which is to build the pig-raising business because it is very profitable. His mother-in-law supports this. This is the first time that they have applied for a loan on the recommendation of his mother-in-law, who is also a Caja Rural client. With this loan he wishes to begin selling watermelon as an ambulatory vendor because he used to earn his living with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in Recycling and Purchase of Fruit

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: H. Edwige est née le 07 Novembre 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AHODI James un maintenancier, Edwige est mère de deux enfants, dont un seulement est scolarisé. C'est depuis 17 ans que Edwige réside au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou. Edwige et James supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Edwige a été à l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Edwige mène pour activité, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Edwige s'approvisionne. Edwige est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement, de renforcer son activité et de faire face à la nombreuse demande de sa clientèle, Edwige sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Edwige est née le 07 Novembre 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AHODI James un maintenancier, Edwige est mère de deux enfants, dont un seulement est scolarisé. C'est depuis 17 ans que Edwige réside au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou. Edwige et James supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Edwige a été à l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Edwige mène pour activité, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Edwige s'approvisionne. Edwige est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement, de renforcer son activité et de faire face à la nombreuse demande de sa clientèle, Edwige sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Leidy Laura

texts.es:
Leidy Laura es una socia emprendedora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 29 años, Leidy Laura  es una joven soltera que se dedica a la compra-venta D. prendas D. vestir, ella cuenta con una cartera D. clientes que les da crédito y cobra diariamente. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres perseverantes II” desD. hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles
que lo utilizó para comprar polos y ofrecerlos a sus conocidos. En la actualidad Leidy necesita un crédito D. 1700 soles que será utilizado ejn la compra D. prendas D. vestir para damas. La meta D. Leidy Laura es ampliar su negocio, tener una variedad D. prendas D. vestir y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Leidy Laura, 29, is an enterprising member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is a single young lady that sells clothing. She has an established customer base to whom she sells on credit and collects payments daily. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Perseverantes II" (Persevering Women II) communal bank for the past year. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy polo shirts to sell to her acquaintances. Currently, Leidy needs a 1700 sol loan to buy ladies' clothing. Leidy Laura's goal is to enlarge her business, have a wiD. variety of clothing items, and increase her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ladies' clothes.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides tiene 25 años de edad y vive con su cónyuge quien se decida a operario de construcción.  Tienen una menor hija de tres años de edad.  Él tiene una amplia experiencia como operario de construcción ya que se inició en esta labor desde muy joven.  Actualmente cuenta con un ingreso rentable ya que está laborando para una ONG en la construcción de un colegio en el lugar donde vive.  Su cónyuge támbien es una persona que labora temporalmente en fundos agrícolas.  Actualmente no está laborando por cuidar a su menor hija.  Ellos cuentan con casa propia de material rustico.  Alcides es un joven con muchos objetivos y metas uno de ellos es tener sus propio maquinarias.  El dinero que solicita es para completar la compra de un trompito el cual le está costando en promedio S/. 5800.  Se financiará la diferencia ya que él cuenta con el dinero producto de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alcides is 25 years old and lives with his wife, who is a construction worker. They have a three-year-old daughter. He has extensive experience as a construction worker because he began working in this field when he was very young. Currently he has sufficient income because he is working for an NGO, building a school in the area where he lives. His wife also works as a temporary agricultural worker. At present she is not working in order to take care of her young daughter. They have their own house made out of rustic materials. Alcides is a young man with many objectives and goals, one of which is to own his own construction equipment. This loan will be used to complete his purchase of a cement mixer which will cost him about 5800 Soles. He will finance the difference from his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Salome M.  from Tukuyu. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 18 and 24. Salome has been running a clothes business since 2006. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week Salome currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Salome thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Oseas

texts.es: Oseas tiene 44 años de edad y vive con su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de golosinas en el colegio Merino Ruiz muy cerca de su casa.  Tienen 3 hijos menores de edad aún están en el colegio.  Él se dedica a la venta de helados hace 5 años y su esposa lo ayuda en la venta de helados los días sábados y domingos.  Ellos cuentan con casa propia el cual están construyendo.  Ya tiene construida las paredes del primer piso y un cuarto construido.  Eso fue con el apoyo del gobiero con el programa de Bono Familiar.  Oseas tiene muchos sueños y objetivos, uno de ellos es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijos.  Son una familia de buenas referencias personales y laborales.  Su cónyuge vende golosinas más de 10 años.  Con el dinero que solicitan es para la mano de obra para terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Oseas is 44 years old and lives with his wife who sells sweets at the Merino Ruiz School near their house. They have 3 young children who are still in school. Oseas has been selling ice cream for the past five years and his wife helps him on Saturdays and Sundays. They have their own house, which is being built. The first floor walls and one room have already been built with the support of the government through the “Bono Familiar” (“Family Voucher”) program. Oseas has many dreams and goals, one of which is to give his children a better quality of life. They are a family with good personal and work references. His wife has been selling sweets for more than 10 years. This loan will be used for labor to finish the construction of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing Improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for business

loans.name: Fifonsi Christine

texts.fr: D. Fifonsi Christine  est née en 1956 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est une veuve et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Christine vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les charges de la famille. C'est depuis 10 ans que Christine réside à Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Christine a le niveau d'étude primaire. Christine mène depuis 10 ans environs comme activité, la vente de plantes médicinale  et des divers à son domicile.  Christine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Christine a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé et qui a été bien remboursé. C’est pour renforcer davantage son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients que Christine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Fifonsi Christine was born in 1956 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is a widow and the mother of three children who are all in school. Two of her children are in her care. She lives alone with her children and has sole responsibility for meeting family expenses. For ten years, she has been residing in Avotrou in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Christine has a primary school education. She has been running a business for ten years selling medicinal plants and a various other goods out of her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. She has already benefited from an ALIDé loan, which has been repaid. To bolster her business further and to cope better with the demands of her customers, she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plants and leaves used in traditional medicines

loans.name: Felista

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Felista A. from Tukuyu. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 7. Felista has been running a tailoring business since 2005, making and selling clothes. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about 110 USD. Felista is requesting a loan in order to buy materials in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her product. She thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: K. Angèle est née en 1968 à Houègo à Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Angèle est mariée à ZINSOU Sagbo Antoine, un maçon et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Angèle vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Angèle supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. C'est depuis 10 ans que Angèle réside à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Angèle n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Angèle mène depuis trois ans environs comme activité, la vente des fruits (orange, etc.) et de l’arachide. Angèle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Angèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d’agrandir son commerce et de la diversifier par la vente du pain sucré, Angèle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Angèle was born in 1968 in Houègo, in Agblangandan, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji. Angèle is married to ZINSOU Sagbo Antoine, a mason, and is the mother of three children, who all attend school. Angèle lives with her children and her husband. She supports the family together with her husband. For ten years, she's been living in Agbalilamè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji in Benin. She never attended school. For about three years, she's been selling fruits (oranges, etc) and peanuts. Angèle gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loans without problems. In order to expand her business and to diversify by selling sweet bread, she's seeking her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of fruits, peanuts, and sweet bread

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Corredores, a rural region of Southern Costa Rica. Juana has a business selling hand-made clothing, necklaces and bracelets from her home. She demonstrates a strong work ethic; assembling jewellery, making and selling clothes by day, while working evenings and nights in a local restaurant as a waitress.

Similar to the story of many low income individuals in Costa Rica, and across the world, Juana has found it impossible to obtain approval for a business loan from the local bank in Corredores. The bank requires a guarantor of a loan to be someone who is not part of her immediate family. Juana does not know any suitable guarantors, with a steady income and a secure job, other than her husband. From Juana´s perspective, the rules of the formal banking system have had the effect of excluding her from the financial services she seeks.

 In an effort to extend the reach of financial services to deserving entrepreneurs, Fundacion Mujer proposes to lend Juana 500,000 colons (around $862 US), with her husband as the loan guarantor. This will be her second loan with Fundacion Mujer. Juana received her first loan in 2008 for 100,000 colons ($173 US) which was repaid from her business earnings, on time and in full, within 6 months.

With this loan, Juana plans to purchase raw materials such as cloth and necklace parts in an effort to expand her jewellery and clothes-selling business. Recently, many of Juana’s regular clients have inquired about the possibility of purchasing shoes. She would like to satisfy this demand and expand her business by providing quality footwear to her clients. She will use this loan to buy shoes from a contact in Panama to sell from her home in Costa Rica. Juana dreams of expanding her business and earning more money so she can provide a better standard of living for her family. She says that since starting her business 2 years ago, her self-confidence has increased. Juana is now a strong believer in her ability to improve living conditions for her family through her determination and hard work. 

Your contribution is a direct investment in the betterment of the lives of families living in a poor community of southern Costa Rica. By lending to Juana, a hard-working entrepreneur, you are enabling her to build towards a higher standard of living. On behalf of Juana and her family, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Affiwa

texts.fr: N. Affiwa est née en 1968 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Affiwa est mariée à AMOUHOUE Paul, un électricien bâtiment, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Affiwa vit seule et assure seule les charges de la famille. C'est depuis 2 ans que Affiwa réside à Lokokokoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Affiwa n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Affiwa mène depuis 05 ans environs comme activité la vente de céréales (riz, haricot, maïs, etc.) à son domicile. Affiwa s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Djouda au Bénin. Affiwa est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et renforcer davantage son activité, que Affiwa sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Affiwa N. was born in 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Paul AMOUHOUE, a building electrician, and she's the mother of three children who all attend school. Affiwa lives alone and provides for the family on her own. For two years, Affiwa has been residing in Lokokokoumè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji in Benin. She never attended school. For about five years, she's been selling cereals (rice, beans, corn, etc) at her house. Affiwa gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin, and in Djouba in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loans without problems. In order to bolster her working capital and strengthen her business, Affiwa is seeking her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals (sacks of rice, white and red beans, and corn)

loans.name: Eduvina

texts.es:
Eduvina tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo (Modesto) D. 50 años, y con su hijo Johan D. 26 años.
DesD. hace 3 años se dedica a la venta D. gas, esta actividad la realiza desD. su casa, compra y distribuye los pedidos D. sus vecinos y demás clientes. Pero eso no es todo, ya que paralelamente venD. aceitunas, otro negocio que es muy fructífero, ya que las ventas son muy buenas, para ello Eduvina debe viajar a otras ciudades para traer este producto.
Eduvina está muy contenta con todo su trabajo, ya que se siente una mujer completa con todo lo que realiza, pues sabe que lleva ingresos extras a su hogar y pueD. brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
Para el futuro, quiere tener un negocio más granD. y así poder obtener más ingresos para tener mayor estabilidad en su hogar.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ella se caracteriza por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para viajar y comprar más aceitunas para abastecer a sus clientes D. tan rico producto.
texts.en:
Eduvina, 48, lives with her husband (Modesto, 50) and their son, Johan, 26. For the last three years she had a home-based gas selling enterprise; she fills orders for her neighbors and others. But this isn't all: she also sells olives, a very profitable business, because sales are good. For this, Eduvina must travel to other cities to get her supplies. She is very happy with her work because she feels fulfilled with everything she accomplishes because she brings extra income to her home and can proviD. her children a better quality of life. For the future, she would like her business to be larger so that she can obtain higher income and have more stability in her home. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very punctual with her repayments. With the funds requested now she will travel to buy more olives to supply her customers with this delicious product.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna es una mujer muy trabajadora de 32 años, vive con su madre en su casa propia, donde tienen su negocio.
Desde hace 5 años dirige su propio centro educativo, el cual instaló en su propia vivienda, ya que siendo de profesión profesora, vio por conveniente plasmar todo lo aprendido en un negocio propio, en el cual pueda enseñar a los niños además de lo académico, los valores humanos. 
A Giovanna le gusta mucho su trabajo es por eso que se dedica netamente a él, al igual que su madre, con la cual están siempre pendientes de las necesidades de los niños en cuanto a infraestructura, equipos, etc. Por tal motivo, piensa que aun debe mejorar la infraestructura para albergar a más alumnos y así brindar mayor comodidad a los niños.
Por ello su siguiente meta es construir un piso más para ampliar los ambientes de estudio.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y ha sido muy puntual con todos sus pagos en los créditos anteriores, es por ello que afirma volverlo a hacerlo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará pintura y materiales para hacer realidad su sueño de hacer crecer su colegio.
texts.en:
Giovanna, 32, is a hard-working woman, who lives with her mother, in her own house, where they conduct their business. She has had an educational center for the last 5 years which she installed in her own home. As a teacher, she saw that it would be appropriate to invest her knowledge in her own business, one in which she can impart to children not only academics, but human values too. Giovanna likes her work very much; this is why she is so dedicated to it, as is her mother. They are always watchful of the needs of the children with respect to infrastructure, equipment, etc. For this reason, she believes that she must improve the infrastructure to accommodate more students and provide more comfort for the children. Her goal, therefore, is to add a floor to enlarge the classroom space. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has been very punctual with repayments of her previous loans. She insures that she will continue to be so. With the funds requested now she will buy paint and building materials to see her goal of enlarging her school come to fruition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to enlarge her school.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2 depuis deux ans. Elle vend des tissu teintés et des chaussures. Elle voudrait renforcer son commerce et participer au bien-être de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D., aged 38, is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of “Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2” for two years. She sells dyed fabrics and footwear. She would like to bolster her business and contribute to her family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Heidi

texts.es:
Heidi tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo (Augusto) de la misma edad, y con su hijo Jefferson de 5 añitos, en su casa propia.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual confecciona ella misma gracias a que estudió corte y confección. Para ello, implementó un pequeño taller en su vivienda donde también recibe todos los pedidos de sus clientes.
Los domingos, es el día cuando Heidi sale a vender las prendas que confecciona, y lo hace en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la zona donde vive, es así que el resto de la semana trabaja en la elaboración y además de la atención de las labores domésticas, las cuales no puede descuidar, pues tiene un hijo pequeño. 
Actualmente se encuentra confeccionando pantalones de un tipo de tela llamado “polar”, el cual es muy caliente, pues aún la temperatura es fría, pero como se aproxima el verano cambiará de rumbo y comenzará a elaborar polos y shorts.
Para el futuro, Heidi quiere comprar máquinas para implementar mejor su taller y obtener mejores ganancias.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela para elaborar sus prendas y mejorar los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Heidi, 25, lives with her husband (Augusto, 25) and their son, Jefferson, 5, in their own home. She has sold clothing, which she makes herself, for the last year. She studied clothes-making. She equipped a small workshop in her home where she receives her customers' orders. On Sundays Heidi goes out to one of the busiest markets near her home to sell her home-made items. The rest of the week she works making the items and taking care of domestic chores, which she can't neglect, because she has a small child. Curently she is making pants from fabric known as "polar" which is very warm because it is still cold season. However, since Summer is on its way, she will change directions and make shorts and polo shirts. For the future, Heidi wants to buy sewing machines to better equip her workshop and earn higher profits. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with her repayments. With the funds requested she will buy a larger amount of fabric to make her clothes and improve her business's earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene 77 años y comparte su vida con Yolanda, su esposa de 64 años; ellos viven solos, ya que no tuvieron hijos. 

Desde hace 15 años, juntos se dedican a la venta de comestibles en un puesto que tienen en el mercado de su localidad. Este negocio les ha dado satisfacciones y una vida tranquila y gracias a él pueden solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ellos abren todos los días a las 8 de la mañana hasta promediarse las 6 de la tarde, así pasan sus días, con la esperanza de seguir mejorando, pues le tienen mucho cariño a su negocio. Gracias a su grata hospitalidad y gentileza en el trato, ellos tienen gran cantidad de clientes que prefieren comprar en su puesto, ya que saben que serán muy bien atendidos. Para el futuro, José quiere surtir su tienda de más y mejores productos para así duplicar su clientela y sabe que con este préstamo se le hará posible.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por ello menciona que cuando se trata de cumplir con pagos, es muy puntual y responsable. Con el dinero que solicita abastecerá su tienda con más productos para lograr su meta de generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
José is a very hard working person. He is 77 years old and has shared his life with his wife Yolanda for the past 64 years. As they never had children, they live alone. For the past 15 years, they have run a grocery business from the stand they have at the market in their community. This business has given them a lot of satisfaction and a pleasant life. Thanks to God they have been able to cover the expenses of their home. They are open every day from 8 in the morning until about 6 in the afternoon. They pass their days with the hope of continued improvement. They have a lot of love for their business. Thanks to their hospitality and gentle nature, they have a lot of clients that prefer to shop at their stall because they know they will be well attended. In the future Jose wants to stock his store with better and M. products so he can double his customer base. He knows that with this loan it will be possible. This is his first loan with MFP so it is worth mentioning that when it comes to his payments, he is very punctual and responsible. With this loan he will supply his store and with the increase in products he'll achieve his goal of a higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery products

loans.name: Silvia Filomena

texts.es: Doña Silvia Filomena S. su negocio es el alquiler de cuartos, tiene doce años en este negocio el cual ha logrado hacer mejoras a las habitaciones, para dar un mejor servicio, procreo tres hijos, dos están en los Estados Unidos de América los cuales le envían remesas para sus necesidades, y medicamentos y el otro  esta trabajando aquí, el cual vive con ella. Los cuartos son alquilados por extranjeros. Tiene 61 años de edad, y vive en un reparto de Mostatepe, con este préstamo quiere dar mantenimiento a los cuartos de pintura, baños, puertas. Con el fin de poder pedir un buen precio en donde pueda pagar los gastos básicos como: Agua, luz, pago de limpieza. A si como poder estar en mejores condiciones de vida. Su mayor anhelo es poder ver a sus hijos pronto ya que ellos  emigraron con el fin de poder encontrar un mejor trabajo para ganar mejor y poder ayudarse económicamente. Como madre me siento contenta pero se han quedado allá en donde hay mejores oportunidades de empleo,  y se han  formalizado con su familia. Es por eso no vienen seguido al país.
texts.en:
Silvia Filomena S.’s business is the rental of rooms, she’s had this business for 12 years and has done betterments to the rooms to provide a better service. She has three children, two are in the United States of America and send her money for her needs and medicine, the third children lives with her. The rooms are rented to foreigners. She is 61 years old and lives in Mostatepe, with this loan she wants to give maintenance to the rooms such as painting, bathrooms and doors. This is also with the objective to be able to charge a good price that would be sufficient to pay the basic utilities such as: water, power and cleaning services. In addition, she wants to have better living conditions. Her big wish is to be able to see her children soon, they emigrated with the purpose of finding a better job to make better money; as a mother she feels happy because they are in a place with better work opportunities and have established a family. This is why they don’t travel back to the country often.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar pintura para pintar cuartos, reparar inodoro y puertas

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: K. Marie est née en 1984 et est mariée à KANVE Gabriel, un chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants en charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants et sont scolarisés. Marie vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Agbalilamè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin, depuis onze ans. Les charges de la famille sont supportées ensemble par le couple. Marie n’a pas été à l’école et a appris le métier de couture. A côté de ce métier,Marie mène comme activité depuis quatre ans, la vente d'habits qu'elle coud et également des chaussures à son domicile. Marie  s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Marie  sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Marie K. was born in 1984 and she is married to Gabriel Kanve, a hairdresser. They take care of four children; three of them are their own children and all of them are attending school. For the past eleven years Marie has lived with her children and her husband in Agbalilamè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji, Benin. The couple provides together for the family expenses. Marie did not attend school and has learned tailoring. Beside this job, four years ago Marie has started a retail business at home and she sells clothes, that she sews, as well as shoes. Marie gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is an old client of ALIDé and she has fully repaid her previous loans. In order to improve her operating fonds and to reinforce her business, she is now requesting to ALIDé her third loan.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothes and tailoring supplies

loans.name: G.s. Chavarria.- Group

texts.es: La Señora Paula C. y Juana del Carmen pertenecen al grupo solidario Chavarría, no es la primera vez que juntas realizan financiamientos. Porque son de mucha ayuda.  Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas. La Señora Juana del Carmen tiene 45 años es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a una pulpería tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues cuando inicio fue con capital de trabajo propio, y con el tiempo obtuvo la ayuda del banco, incrementando su inventario para obtener más clientes, y que su negocio crezca más. Ellas son personas muy responsables y que les gustaría salir adelante. El sueño de ellas es seguir adelante con cada uno de sus negocios.
texts.en:
. Paula C. and Juana del Carmen, 45, are members of the Chavarría communal bank. This isn't the first time that they have requested joint financing because they are of much help. Both women have different lines of work. Juana del Carmen is a single mother and has two children. She has operated a small general store for the last 6 years. She began it using her own funds and, in time, sought help from the bank to increase her inventory to attract more customers and have her business grow. They are very responsible persons who would like to get ahead in life. Their dream is to continue making progress in each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo (Félix) de 43 años, y con su hija María de 19 años, quien es la adoración de ambos.
Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de gas, actividad que viene realizando en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la zona donde vive. Su trabajo consiste en abastecerse de balones de gas de la distribuidora, para luego venderlos por unidad a sus clientes. A María le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite tener libertad para pasar tiempo con su hija, aunque algunas veces le resulta cansado atender ella sola su negocio; pero María se ha adaptado a su ritmo de trabajo y es por ello que quiere progresar haciendo un negocio más rentable. 

Este es el segundo préstamo de María con MFP y esta vez promete ser tan puntual como lo fue en su crédito anterior. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de balones de gas para incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
María, 41, lives with her husband, Félix, 43, and their 19-year-old daughter, María, who is the apple of her parents' eyes. For the last nine years she has sold gas in one of her area's busiest markets. Her work consists in stocking up on gas tanks from the gas distributor to subsequently resell to her customers. María enjoys her work very much because it gives her the freedom to spend time with her daughter, although sometimes it is fatiguing for her to tend to her sales all day by herself; but María has adapted to her work pace and wants to make her store more profitable. This is her second loan with MFP and María pledges to be as punctual with repayments now as she has been in the past. With the funds requested she will increase the number of gas tanks she buys to increase her available stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Maritza Guadalupe

texts.es: Maritza Guadalupe de 44 años es soltera, madre 3 hijos, el mayor de 21 años que trabaja y le ayuda, uno de 16 años cursando el 5to año de secundaria y el menor de 6 añitos en 1er grado de primaria, labora para el MINED de Acoyapa desde hace 14 años desempeñandose como maestra de primaria en la Escuela Puertas Rojas en una comarca de Acoyapa, todos los dias se le levanta muy temprano para salir en bicicleta a la escuelita en donde imparte el pan de la enseñanza a los niños de esa comunidad; esta solicitando su 8vo credito para mejorar su casa, levantando la pared de enfrente que se encuentra en mal estado y comprar la puerta y ventanas, y de esta manera darle mas seguridad a su vivienda.  Expresa que con los creditos que AFODENIC le ha brindado a logrado mejorar su casa aunque hasta ahora espera ser beneficiada con el fondo kiva.  Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y tengan una carrera universitaria que les permita tener un mejor nivel de vida y seguir mejorando su casa que es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza Guadalupe, 44, is single and the mother of three children: the eldest, 21, who works and helps out with household expenses, one who is 16 and in the 11th grade, and the youngest, who is six, and in the first grade. For the last 14 years she has been an employee of the Ministry of Education as an elementary school teacher at the Puertas Rojas School in Acoyapa. She must get up very early every day to ride her bicycle to work at the little school where she teaches the children of the area. She is asking for her 8th loan to improve her house by building a front wall to replace the damaged one there now as well as to buy the door and windows. She hopes, thereby, to provide better security to her home. She says that the loans that AFODENIC has provided have allowed her to have a better house and now she hopes to be a beneficiary of Kiva Fund. Her greatest wish is that her children study and have a university career that will allow them to have a better quality of life and to continue improving her house, which is the asset she means to leave her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda T., 38 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants est membre du Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2 depuis un an et demi. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce de tissus et de chaussures. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en:
Aïda T., aged 38, is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of “Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2” for 1½ years. This loan will allow her to bolster her business selling cloth and shoes. She helps her husband provide for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: O. Justine

texts.fr: A. O. Justine est née le 09 Mars 1981 à Adja-Ouèrè au Bénin. Justine est mariée à HOUNKPATIN Evrard, un patissier. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent avec leurs parents. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Justine a fréquenté jusqu'au cours secondaire. Il y a trois ans de cela que Justine vend des divers (sardine, pâtes alimentaire, sacs de riz, savons, papiers hygiéniques, eau en sachet "Pur Water", etc.)de même que des boissons dans sa boutique sise à Avotrou, à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Justine s'approvisionne. Justine a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l'a bien remboursé. C'est pour renforcer son stock de produits et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, que Justine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. O. Justine was born on March 9, 1981 in Adja-Ouèrè in Benin. She is married to HOUNKPATIN Evrard, a pastry chef. The couple has two children who are both in school and living with their parents. The couple provides for the family jointly. Justine has attended secondary school. For three years, she has been selling a variety of goods (sardines, pasta, sacks of rice, soaps, toilet paper, "Pur Water" pouches of water, etc.), as well as drinks in her shop located in Avotrou, Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She once had an ALIDé loan, and she repaid it. To bolster her stock of merchandise and to cope better with the demand of her customers, she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various goods (sardines, pasta, sacks of rice, soaps, etc.)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy trabajadora de 49 años, vive con su esposo (Emilio), de 45 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Miguel de 27, Yahir de 22 y Víctor de 11 años; todos ellos viven muy contentos en su casa propia.

Su negocio es la venta de productos de belleza, ella es profesora y enseña en una escuela por las mañanas, estando libre por las tardes, es por ello que decidió emplear este tiempo en algo productivo, pues tiene muchas amigas y vecinas que necesitan de estos productos. 
Para ello, María se inscribió con una conocida empresa de distribución de cosméticos por catálogo, y manos a la obra, comenzó a ofrecer los productos y ahora le va muy bien.
Además de seguir ejerciendo su vocación como maestra, se siente muy a gusto con su negocio propio, aunque le resulta cansado tener que caminar tanto, por lo demás es muy gratificante.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock, además mejorar su material educativo, para trabajar de mejor manera.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking woman who is 49 years old and lives with her husband Emilio, 45, and their 3 children: Miguel (27), Yahir (22) and Victor (11). They all live very happily together in their own home. Her business is selling beauty products. She is a teacher and teaches in a school in the mornings and is free in the afternoons. For this reason she decided to use this time doing something productive. She has many friends and neighbors who need these products. To do this, Maria signed up with a well-known company that distributes cosmetics by catalog and, getting down to business, she began to offer the products. Now this business is going very well. In addition, she continues in her position as a teacher. She feels very content having her own business, although as a result she is often tired from having to walk so much, but otherwise it is very rewarding. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual with her payments. With the money that she requests she will buy more beauty products to have on hand, and in addition she will improve her educational materials so that she can perform her work in a better way.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como camisas, polos, pantalones, etc.; los cuales produce al por mayor, pues junto a su esposo implementaron su taller y contrataron a 2 personas para lograr abastecerse con la producción. Mientras su esposo cose y corta, Rosa se dedica al planchado y a los acabados de las prendas para posteriormente entregarlas a las personas que les hicieron el pedido.
Rosa y su esposo se encuentran muy contentos porque obtienen buenos ingresos, es por ello que están pensando en agrandar su negocio, comprando más maquinaria que les facilite el trabajo.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Rosa con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más tela (al por mayor) para aumentar la producción de sus prendas y así obtener mayores ingresos para su familia y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and children.

For two years, Rosa has been producing articles of clothing such as blouses, polo shirts, trousers, etc. She manufactures these items in large quantities. Her husband helped with establishing her workshop and they hired two employees to help with the production. While her husband sews and cuts, Rosa is responsible for ironing the finished garments and delivering them to the customer. Rosa and her husband are very happy that they are able to generate a good income, which is why they are planning to expand their business. They will purchase additional machinery to facilitate their work.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Rosa has always been known to be timely in making her payments. The money she requested will be used to purchase fabric in bulk so that she can increase the production of garments, obtain better earnings for her family, and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Concorde Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Concorde Plus » est une banque communautaire composée de 32 micro entrepreneurs dont Lutonadio N. est dirigeante. Ils se sont constitués sur base de la caution solidaire pour obtenir des microcrédits de la part de Kiva et de l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de développer leurs affaires.
Lutonadio N. a comme activité principale la vente de farine de maïs et de manioc dans la partie Est de Kinshasa. Elle a commencé cette cette micro entreprise en 1987. Elle a déjà bénéficié 4 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et a correctement remboursé. Elle compte avec le prochain prêt diversifier son affaire en y ajoutant des poissons salés dans le but d’accroitre son revenu. Lutonadio est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 6 et 19 ans. Cinq d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
"Concorde Plus" is a community bank composed of 32 micro-entrepreneurs, including Lutonadio N., who is the leader. They established themselves guaranteeing one another jointly in order to obtain micro-loans via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. Lutonadio N. has a main business selling cassava flour and cornmeal in the eastern part of Kinshasa. She started this micro-enterprise in 1987. She has already benefited four times from HOPE RDC loans, which she has repaid properly. With the next loan, she intends to diversify her business by including salted fish with the goal of growing her revenues. Lutonadio is married and the mother of five children, ranging from 6 to 19 years of age. Five of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify her business by buying baskets of salted fish to sell for boosting her capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Développement Plus Group

texts.fr:
Anne N. est dirigeante d’un groupe de 25 micro entrepreneurs dénommé « Développement Plus ». Ces membres se sont solidairement engagés à bénéficier des microcrédits de la part des préteurs du monde entier à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de soutenir leurs activités.
Anne vend de la farine de manioc et du maïs au marché situé dans la partie la plus montagneuse du sud-ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Elle aime beaucoup son affaire qu’elle a commencée il y a plusieurs années. Elle compte la diversifier grâce au prêt qu’elle recevra prochainement. Son ambition est d’élargir ses activités afin d’accroitre le revenu qui va permettre à supporter les études de ses enfants. Anne est mariée et mère de 8 enfants âgés de 13 à 36 ans et dont 3 vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Anne N. is the leader of a group of 25 micro-entrepreneurs called “Développement Plus”. These members are committed to each other in solidarity to benefit from micro-loans from the lenders of the world via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC with the goal of supporting their businesses. Anne sells cassava flour and cornmeal at the market located in the most mountainous area southwest of the city of Kinshasa. She really likes her business, which she started several years ago. She intends to diversify, thanks to the loan she’ll receive shortly. Her ambition is to expand her business in order to grow her revenues. This is going to enable her to cover her children’s schooling. Anne is married and the mother of eight children, ranging from 13 to 16 years of age. Three of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of cassava and corn to sell to boost her capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is divorced with a grown son. She lives in Stryi and sells grocery items in one of the local food markets. Lubov has much experience working as a market vendor which helps her in her business endeavors as well. Her business is characterized by stability and consistency. She has been working in this trade for nine years. Currently, she has about 6,000 Grivnyas invested in merchandise. 

Lubov is seeking a loan of 9,750 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and offer a wider variety of it for sale in her kiosk. She would like to increase the efficiency of her business and believes that additional financial assistance will help her with this plan.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr: Sira C. est une femme de 51 ans, elle mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle développe un commerce de poisson, de légumes et de savons. Ce prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité et les bénéfices lui permettront de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Sira C. is a 51 year old woman who is married and is the mother of 8 children. She is expanding a business selling fish, vegetables and soaps. This loan will help her to strengthen her business and the profits will allow her to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her revenue generating activity

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a small entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk where she sells men’s jackets in the central marketplace. Nina has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, she has about 80,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. 

Nina is seeking a loan of 14,500 Grivnyas to expand her trade. She is achievement-oriented and has confidence in her abilities and powers. We believe these crucial characteristics that Nina possesses will secure further growth of her trade and prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To expand her trade

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two adult children. She has a retail business selling gift bags and artificial flowers. Tatyana started this business 15 years ago with one small table. Since that time she has been able to develop it well. Today Tatyana has two business locations and offers a large variety of products to her clients. This business has been the only source of income for Tatyana's family.

Tatyana would like to borrow 8,900 Ukrainian grivna to purchase more inventory. Tatyana wants to develop her business further and try selling women's clothing at one of her business locations.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Izet

texts.fr: Izte C. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a également la charge de sa maman. Ce prêt lui permettre de développer un petit commerce de tabac, de thé, de sucre, de savon en poudre etc. Le bénéfice réalisé à partir de son commerce servira partiellement à subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Izte C. is a 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children.  She also has her mother to support.  This loan will allow her to develop a small business for tobacco, tea, sugar, powdered soap, etc.  The profits earned from her commerce will be used to meet some of the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her the domain of commerce

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married with two teenage kids. He lives in Melitopol along with his family. Oleg owns a small business selling men’s outerwear in one of the local markets of his hometown. He has been in this business for eight years. Presently, he has 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His monthly net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.

Oleg is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital. He always jokes he has chosen this type of inventory because men are easier to please. Oleg is planning to expand his venture even further. He is hoping to be able to use available lending services in the future as well. Oleg is planning to use his newly generated profits to finish remodeling his apartment.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Mikhailo

texts.en:
Mikhailo is married. He lives in Korolyovo and sells bicycle parts in the central marketplace. His vending kiosk is located right in the center of the market, which makes it a good attraction for potential customers. Mikhailo has been in this trade for five years. Currently, he has 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His gross income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month. Monthly net profit doesn’t exceed 3,000 Grivnyas. 

Mikhailo is seeking a loan of 8,500 Grivnyas to increase his working capital. This will give him the flexibility to purchase inventory at reduced prices and help him pursue his goals for business expansion. Mikhailo is a goal-oriented businessman who’d like to continue growing his enterprise by opening new sales locations.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with a 9-year-old daughter. She runs a small venture selling knitwear in her hometown of Novyi Rozdil. Nataliya owns a vending kiosk in one of the local markets. Her husband is actively helping her with the business. Nataliya has been in this trade for seven years. Presently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. 

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise. Nataliya is an experienced vendor as she used to work as a salesperson in the market before she launched her business. Nataliya is a true optimist. She never gives up and always tries to cheer up others around her. One of her long-term plans is to open a small clothing store in Novyi Rozdil.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is widowed. She has a retail business selling men's clothing at the Yulana market in Pavlograd town. She has been in this business for only two years. Valentina has plans to develop her business and sell shoes along with clothing. She offers great client service and attracts clients by her prices and the good location of her kiosk. Valentina would like to borrow 3,300 Ukrainian grivna to purchase men's sweaters.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Nuñez Group

texts.es: Este Grupo Solidario Núñez tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que son mujeres muy responsables.  Está conformado por María y Milagro del Socorro ambas poseen las mismas actividades económicas como la venta de comida Milagro tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y como toda madre responsable mantiene a sus 4 hijos. Milagro  no cuenta con todos los ingresos necesarios, para mantener a todos sus hijos por lo que busca la forma de esta manera.  El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de granos básicos, carnes y otros.
texts.en:
The Núñez Solidarity Group has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time. Both women are very responsible. The group consists of María P. and Milagros del Socorro, both of whom are in the same business of selling food. Milagros is 29 years old and a single mother responsible for 4 children. She tells us that her income is necessary for maintaining her children, which is why she is seeking this funding. The loan will be used as operating capital to purchase necessary items such as grains, meat, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase grains, meat, and other products

loans.name: Baptisseurs Plus Group

texts.fr:
Jean Patrice B. est président du groupe dénommé « Bâtisseurs Plus » composé de 27 micro entrepreneurs engagés solidairement à bénéficier des prêts de Kiva et de l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de développer leurs activités.
Jean Patrice gère sa propre boutique générale dans une zone périphérique  située à l’Ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Il est entré dans le monde de micro entreprise depuis 1994. Il aime son affaire et il en a acquit une solide expérience. Jean Patrice a déjà démontré sa fidélité en recevant 4 fois les crédits chez IMF HOPE RDC qu’il a correctement remboursé. Le prochain prêt lui permettra de renforcer le stock de sa boutique en achetant divers articles tels que du savon, des conserves, du sucre, etc… en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Son ambition est d’élargir sa boutique en y ajoutant des vêtements mixtes. Jean Patrice est âgé de 50 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 6 et 23 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Jean Patrice B. is the president of a group names "Bâptisseurs Plus" composed of 27 micro-entrepreneurs committed in solidarity to benefiting from loans from Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.  Jean Patrice manages his own general store in an outlying area west of the city of Kinshasa.  He entered the world of micro-finance in 1994.  He likes his business, and he has acquired solid experience from it.  He has already demonstrated his trustworthiness by receiving a loan four times from HOPE RDC that he has repaid properly.  The next loan will enable him to bolster the inventory in his store by purchasing a variety of goods, such as soap, canned foods, sugar, etc... with the aim of growing his revenues. His ambition is to expand his store by adding clothing for men and women.  He is 50 years old, married, and the father of six children, ranging from 6 to 23 years of age.  All of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various goods, such as soap, canned foods, etc... for bolstering his store inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Avec son prêt elle fabrique et vend des jus naturels et de glace, elle vend également des cacahouètes. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille à partir des bénéfices qu'elle réalise.
texts.en:
Awa N. is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. With her loan, she is making and selling natural juices and ice cream. She also sells peanuts. From the profits she earns, she takes part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Lesbia de 44 años de edad es casada, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 21 años que trabaja y le ayuda a su mamá y 2 niñas de 12 y 14 años, las cuales estudian, su esposo trabaja fuera del pais y le envia dinero para los gastos del hogar.  Lesbia es vendedora de productos de oro y plata, en donde obtiene ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.  Obtuvo una vivienda en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan, la cual quiere mejorar, por lo que esta solicitando su 1er credito para construir un garaje y terminar el porche, cuenta con algunos materiales y con este credito le permitiria concluir con este proyecto, pues la casa es pequeña y sus hijas son adolecentes y necesitan su espacio.  Expresa sentirse muy agradecida con AFODENIC pues gracias a esta institucion ha logrado obtener su hogar, ademas espera poder seguir siendo beneficiada con otros creditos para seguir dando mejores condiciones a su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Lesbia is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. The oldest child is 21 years old, working, and helps around the house. The two younger daughters, ages 12 and 14, are students. Her husband works outside the country and sends money for household expenses. Lesbia sells gold and silver products to earn additional money to support her family. She has a home in the neighborhood of El Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan.

Lesbia wants to make some improvements to her home, so she is requesting her first loan in order to build a garage and complete the porch. She will purchase the materials needed to finish these projects. Having teenagers in a small house, she needs the additional space. Lesbia expresses her appreciation to AFODENIC for helping her obtain this home. She hopes to continue benefitting from future loans so that she can continue improving the condition of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a porch & a garage

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Yulia is married with two children. She sells jeans and clothing from a rented space at a department store. Yulia has been in this business for six years. She started it because her family was in need. Little by little she gained experience, increased the assortment of products and attracted repeat clients. Today her income is 3,500 Ukrainian grivna per month. That enables Yulia to take care of her family.

Yulia would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase her assortment of products. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income for her family.

loans.use: To increase product assortment

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 30 años, vive muy contenta en su casa propia al lado de su hija, Sheyna, de 12 años de edad.
Su negocio es la venta y de gas, ella adquiere los balones de una distribuidora de gas y posteriormente los vende individualmente a sus vecinos y demás clientes que se acercan a su negocio en busca de este combustible. Las ventas son buenas, pues además de su esfuerzo, ha contratado a un ayudante quien reparte los balones en moto, haciendo de su negocio más eficiente y competitivo, ya que llegan hasta la puerta de las casas de sus clientes.
Dolores está muy contenta, pues ve mejorar su negocio y espera que en el futuro pueda comprar un carro repartidor, con el cual pueda abastecer a muchos más clientes y más rápido.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y ella se caracteriza por ser muy responsable con los pagos al igual que sus compañeros de grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de balones de gas para obtener más ingresos para su familia; además seguirá ahorrando para hacer realidad su sueño de adquirir su propio carro para distribuir los balones.
texts.en:
Dolores is 30 years old. She is happy to be living at home with her daughter Sheyna, who is 12 years old.

Dolores operates a business selling gas. She acquires containers filled with gas from a distributor and then sells them individually to her neighbors and other customers who come by her shop in need of fuel. Sales have been good thanks to her efforts. Dolores has also hired an assistant who delivers gas containers by motorbike to the doorsteps of her customers, thereby making her more efficient and competitive. She is very happy that her business is improving. In the future, she hopes to buy a delivery truck so that she can supply more customers and provide faster service.

This is her second loan with MFP. Dolores is known for being very responsible with her payments, just like the rest of the Communal Bank members. She will use the money to buy more gas containers so that she can earn more income for her family. This will also enable her to save up enough money to fulfill her dream of purchasing a delivery vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase containers of gas

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos: Jhon de 23, Bryan de 17 y Jean Pier de 12 años, en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo pueden llamar propia. La venta de gas es el negocio al que se dedica Jenny desde hace 3 años, actividad que es uno de los sustentos fundamentales de su familia. Su esposo es comerciante y juntos se apoyan para salir adelante. Mientras Jenny atiende el negocio de la venta de gas su esposo se dedica a la venta de CDs de música y películas. Jenny tiene que estar pendiente del envío de los balones de gas a los clientes que hacen los pedidos, además de la compra de más balones vacíos para hacer el pedido a la distribuidora. Ella está muy contenta con su trabajo, pues poco a poco va mejorando su negocio.

Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de balones de gas, además de CDs  para ayudar al negocio de su esposo y así mejorar ambos para el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
Jenny is 39 years old, married, and has three children: Jhon (age 23), Bryan (age 17), and Jean Pier (age 12). She and her family live in a house that she is proud to call her own.

Jenny has been selling gas for three years as a means of providing basic support to her family. Her husband is a merchant and they support one another to get ahead. While Jenny tends to her gas business, her husband sells music CDs and DVD movies. She has pending deliveries of gas cylinders to clients who have placed orders. In addition, she wants to buy more empty containers so that she can submit another order to her gas distributor. Jenny is very happy with her work and her business is gradually improving.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has always made her payments on time. Jenny will use the money to purchase containers of gas in bulk, as well as CDs for her husband’s business in hopes of improving both businesses for the sake of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase containers of gas & CDs for her husband's business

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Angela es casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, trabaja para el MINED como profesora de primariaen El Centro Escolar Pablo Hurtado de Juigalpa, todos los dias Angela se levanta muy temprano a alistar a sus niños para luego trasladarse a su trabajo como docente; el marido labora como electricista residencial el que la apoya con sus compromisos y el sostenimiento familiar, esta solicitando su 2do credito para construir una habitacion para sus hijos, pues carecen de ella, y si el credito lo permite repellar la casa para reforzar las paredes, su mayor sueño es alcanzar mejorar su vivenda de forma digna para asi tener mejres condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Angela is married and has two school-age children. She works for the Ministry of Education (MINED) as an elementary school teacher at the Pablo Hurtado Scholastic Center in Juigalpa. Every day Angela wakes up early so that she can take her children to school and proceed to her teaching job. Her husband works as a residential electrician in order to support the family commitments.

Angela is requesting her second loan in order to build a room for her children. She will also have her house plastered in order to reinforce the walls. Her dream is to complete these improvements so that she can have a dignified home that provides her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room & plaster the walls of the house

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su madre.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de muebles hechos de cuero, los cuales fabrica en el taller que implementó en su casa. Para este negocio tiene dos ayudantes y 3 personas más que realizan el tallado del cuero. Sus ventas las realiza a pedido, y en muchas ocasiones utiliza el internet para ello.
A José le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es propio y además puede generar trabajo para otras personas, pues así progresan juntos con miras al crecimiento de su producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cuero, madera, y otros materiales necesaR. para elaborar los muebles solicitados.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He lives in his own home next door to his mother. For the past 5 years, José has been manufacturing and selling leather furniture. His workshop is located in his home. For his business, José has two assistants and three additional employees who design the leather carvings. His sales are completed through orders, and he receives several through the Internet. José enjoys his work because he owns the business and is able to provide employment for other people. He also like watching the progress he has made as production has increased.

This is his first loan with MFP. José commits to making all of his payments on time. The money he requested will be used to purchase leather, wood, and other necessary materials for producing furniture by request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, wood, and other materials

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, donde también tiene su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de CDs, los cuales son muy demandados por las personas, pues ofrece gran cantidad y variedad de películas, videos musicales, documentales, etc. y esto ha logrado que tenga buenas ventas, generando un buen ingreso económico a su familia.
A Roxana le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es muy tranquilo y puede realizar las labores de su hogar, teniendo a una de sus hijas como apoyo para la atención. 
Roxana quiere tener mayor éxito en este negocio y es por ello que se dedica mucho a él, para el futuro quisiera comprar estantes donde pueda mostrar mucho mejor los CDs que tiene y brindarle mejor comodidad a los clientes cuando se acercan a verlos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual con sus pagos, ya que se considera un apersona muy puntual y responsable. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer de mejor manera su negocio.
texts.en:
Roxana is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and children in her own home, which is also where she has her business. Rosanna sells DVDs, which are in great demand. She offers a variety of films, music videos, documentaries, and other genres. Sales have been good, which enables her to provide a decent income for her family.

What Roxana enjoys most about her job is that it is very quiet and she is able to get much work done at home, especially having a daughter who still requires supervision. She wants her business to be successful and has invested a lot of effort into it. In the future, she wants to buy shelves so that she can display more DVDs and provide better convenience to customers who want to view the merchandise up close.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Roxana has always made her payments on time, which explains why she is known as a punctual and responsible person. The money she is requesting will be used to buy more DVDs to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more DVDs

loans.name: Milagro Maria

texts.es: Milagro de 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos niños, un varòncito de 6 años  y una niña de 1 añito, labora en la financiera FAMA como Jefe Servicio Financiero, esa solicitando 2do refinancimiento y espera ser beneficiada por el fondo kiva para compra de material de construcciòn y construir un dormitorio en su casa, su marido le ayuda para los gastos del hogar, se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer emprendedora responsable, honesta, reconocido en la comunidad con buenas referencias crèditicia, es muy responsable con sus compromisos, posee capacidad y voluntad de pago. El mayor sueño de Milagro es poder tener una vivienda digna con las condiciones basicas para que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente amplio y agradable.
texts.en:
Milagro is 29 years old and married. She has two small children, a 6 year old son and a 1 year old daughter.

Milagro works for Financiera FAMA as a financial services manager. She is requesting her second loan and hopes to be the beneficiary of Kiva funding so that she can buy construction materials to build a bedroom in her house. Her husband helps with the household expenses. Milagro is characterized as an enterprising, responsible, and honest woman. She is known in her community and has good credit references. In addition, she has demonstrated responsibility in her commitments, as well as the capacity and willingness to repay her loans.

Milagro’s dream is to have a decent home with the basic necessities so that her children can grow up in a spacious and pleasant environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Resurrection Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Résurrection Plus », est une banque communautaire constituée de 31 micros entrepreneurs solidairement unis dont Mamie B. est présidente. Ce groupe est engagé à recevoir des microcrédits de prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC en vue de renforcer leurs activités.
Mamie B. 50 ans, gère sa propre boutique générale dans un quartier localisé dans la partie montagneuse du sud-ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Après avoir  exercé cette activité pendant plusieurs années, elle en a maitrisé les rouages. Mamie a déjà bénéficié 4 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC qu’elle a totalement remboursé. Le prochain crédit qu’elle attend lui permettra d’acheter 2 paniers des poissons fumés et autres articles divers à revendre dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Actuellement, son activité lui génère hebdomadairement un bénéfice de $30. Mamie a l’ambition de diversifier l’affaire afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs varient entre 12 et 30 ans. Trois d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Resurrection Plus is a community bank with 31 micro-entrepreneurs, headed by Mamie B., their president. They are organized to receive loans from KIVA’s world-wide lenders and the IMF HOPE RDC (International Monetary Fund HOPE in the Democratic Republic of Congo) to support their businesses. Mamie B., aged 50, is married with 5 children, aged 12-30, three of whom are in school. She has a general store in a mountainous area southwest of Kinshasa. She has mastered the nuts and bolts of this business, having run it for several years. She has already received and repaid four previous loans from IMF HOPE RDC. Her next loan will enable her to purchase two lots of smoked fish and other miscellaneous articles for resale. Currently, her business generates an income of $30 a week. Her ambition is to diversify the business and increase her income.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase miscellaneous goods for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: Raisa is married with two children. She runs a small cafe. Raisa just started this business about a year ago. Her desire is to develop it and make it a stable source of income for her family. Raisa needs a loan of 10,000 Ukrainian grivna to purchase equipment for her cafe. She is sure that she can make this business a success with affordable prices, good food and a nice setting.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For the purchase of livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase vegetables to sell & chickens for his wife's business

loans.name: Lidia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Lidia G. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de comestibles como pan, galletas y cokteles al igual que bebidas como gaseosas y jugos siendo comercializadas a diario por ella misma en su localidad.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de los comestibles y para la compra de las bebidas y de esta manera continuar en el negocio obteniendo los ingresos para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Nicaragua, Lidia G. attends to her food sales business. She sells bread, cookies and fruit cocktails, as well as soft drinks and juices.

Lidia is a hard worker and has managed to earn enough to maintain her house. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy food and drink products to sell. This will allow her to continue developing her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food and drinks for sale

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Doña Rosalina de 40 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijas, la mayor de 26 años con 2 hijos que habita con ella y la apoya con los gastos del hogar y la menor de 18 años que estudia. Rosalina viaja una vez a la semana para estar con su familia que habita en su casa la comarca El Papayal, en donde quiere construir un cuarto que mida 4 x 4 mts cuadrados para dar mayores condiciones a sus hijas, pues actualmente la casa es muy pequeña, pero esta junto a la casa de su ancianita mamá, lo que le permitiria estar mas cerca de ella para cuidarla, por lo cual esta solicitando su 5to credito.  Sueña con lograr tener su casa amplia para que su familia pueda vivir comodamente, y si Dios lo permite solicitar otro credito que le ayudaria a cumplir este sueño.  Rosalina expresa sentirse agradecida con AFODENIC, pues con los creditos que le ha financiado ha logrado ir poco a poco mejorar su casa que es el patrimonio de sus hijas y nietos.
texts.en:
Doña Rosalina is 40 years old and a single mother of two daughters. The older one is 26 years old and has two children. Since she lives at home, she contributes toward the household expenses. The younger daughter is an 18 year old student. Rosalina travels once a week to be with her family, who lives at her house in the region of El Papayal. Rosalina wants to add a room to her house that measures 4x4 square meters so that she can provide better conditions for her daughters. Her house is currently small in size, but she plans to take in her elderly mother so that she will be able to have someone look after her. For this reason, she is requesting her fifth loan. Rosalina dreams of having a large house so that her family can live comfortably. If God permits, she would like to apply for another loan in order to fulfill that dream. Rosalina expresses her gratitude to AFODENIC for providing the loans that helped gradually improve her home over time.
