She has been buying and selling kerosene for two months. But, she has been buying and selling livestock for many years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought two sheep because it was not enough to buy cattle. She currently buys and sells kerosene, raises cattle and small animals, and farms for her own consumption. She needs a loan for 2,000 to buy two young bulls to fatten in three months. She will then sell them at the livestock fair.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two young bulls

loans.name: Yania

texts.es:
Yania está casada hace 5 años tiene 3 hijos, vive en la parroquia Andrés De Vera en la ciudad de Portoviejo,  es secretaria ejecutiva de profesión que ejerce en una entidad pública, también se dedica a la  venta  de productos de belleza y cuidado personal  Yanbal en los que  invierte aproximadamente  300 dólares en cada pedido,  sus clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos, lleva cinco años con éste negocio y ha obtenido múltiples satisfacciones, le gusta lo que hace y trata que todo marche bien en el trabajo y en la familia.

Yania es socia del Banco Comunal Fe y Progreso hace 9 ciclos, este banco se formó en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí,  durante todo este tiempo nuestra socia ha venido trabajando con los créditos  recibidos   y está contenta con la labor que realiza la fundación;  con el  nuevo préstamo que recibirá  va a invertir en  un gran pedido de perfumes, cremas, labiales, sombras y todo en cosméticos Yanbal  para entregar a tiempo los pedidos navideños de sus clientes.

El sueño de Yania  es llegar a  tener su propia empresa de publicidad y no descarta la posibilidad porque para eso  está ahorrando.
texts.en:
Yania has been married for five years and has 3 children. She lives in the Andrés De Vera neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo. She is an executive assistant at a public company. She also sells Yanbal beauty and personal care products to her work colleagues and neighbors. She invests approximately $300 dollars in each order. She has been selling Yanbal products for five years and thoroughly enjoys her line of work. She works hard so that she can support her family. Yania is a member of the Fe y Progreso Community Bank and has received 9 loans. The bank was formed in the city of Portoviejo in the province of Manabi. During this time she has used her loans wisely and is very grateful for the support she has received. She will use the loan to purchase a large order of perfume, lotion, lipstick, concealer and various other Yanbal cosmetic products to fulfill her client's Christmas orders. Yania's dream is to save enough money so that she can start her own advertising company.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfume, lipstick, concealer, lotion and foundation from the Yanbal cosmetics line.

loans.name: Blanca Edith

texts.es:
Blanca Edith P. es socia del   Banco Comunal  Fe y Progreso formado en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí,  las socias de éste banco se reúnen  cada quince días en las oficinas de la Fundación Espoir  y se caracterizan por ser muy organizadas.

Blanca Edith es comerciante  tiene un mini bazar  en la sala de su casa que está ubicada en la ciudadela Libertad 2  en las afueras de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ofrece porta retratos, semi joyas, ropa intima para damas, caballeros y niños  y  accesorios de cocina y hogar en general, los exhibe en vitrinas distribuidas en un lugar de la sala de su casa , también recorre su ciudadela ofreciendo a crédito su mercadería, este negocio lo tiene hace 9 años

En esta ocasión el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación Espoir es para comprar  tollas,  sábanas y también adornos, porta retratos y más para surtir su bazar para la época navideña,

Su mayor sueño es poder agrandar su bazar y sabe que con la ayuda de la Fundación Espoir lo lograra.
texts.en:
Bland Edith P. is a member of the Fe y Progreso communal bank (Faith and Progress) in the city of Portoviejo, in the Manabi province. The members of this bank meet every two weeks in the Fundacion Espoir offices and are considered to be very organized. Blanca Edith sells from a “mini bazaar” in her living room located in the Libertad 2 area in the outskirts of the city of Portoviejo. She sells pictures, jewelry with semi-precious stones, underwear for men, women and children, and kitchen utensils and items for the home. She displays these in cases around her living room. For the past 9 years she has also gone around the town selling her products on credit. She is asking for the current loan from Fundacion Espoir to buy towels, sheets and decorative items, picture frames, and more to supply her bazaar for the Christmas season. Her biggest goal is to be able to expand her bazaar and she knows that she will succeed with the help of Fundacion Espoir.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy towels, sheets, picture frames and decorative items for sale during the Christmas season

loans.name: Jessenia Asuncion

texts.es:
Jessenia Z. es una de las  socias  del Banco Comunal de Jave Jireh en Portoviejo.  Las socias de éste banco son muy cristianas y dedicadas a sus trabajos.  Portoviejo es la capital provincial de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador.  La provincia es conocida por su  gastronomía (mariscos) y la Ruta del Sol con sus  hermosas playas. Este banco se caracteriza por sus socias muy puntuales con los pagos y  por la seriedad y responsabilidad de cada una de ellas.

Jessenia tiene 31 años vive con su padre un comerciante de verduras y su hermano que trabaja como chofer, ella se dedica  a la venta  por catálogo de perfumes, maquillajes y todo lo relacionado con cosméticos de la línea Yanbal  y también trabaja como ayudante de costura donde vende sus productos  a sus compañeras y clientes de su trabajo.

Este es el cuarto crédito al que aplica Jessenia y  lo que más le gusta es los servicios de educación que la Fundación imparte  en  temas de enfermedades como el cáncer que antes no sabía. Con el préstamo obtenido  va a comprar más productos  Yanbal como cremas, perfumes, sombras, labiales, y más cosméticos para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes de Manabí y de su localidad.
texts.en:
Jessenia Z. is one of the members of the community bank 'Jave Jireh' in Portoviejo. The members of this bank are strong Christians and dedicated to their work. Portoviejo is the provincial capital of Manabí on the coast of Ecuador. The province is known for its gastronomy (seafood) and the Ruta del Sol (route of the sun) with its beautiful beaches. This bank is distinguished by its members who are very punctual in their repayments, and the seriousness and responsibility with which they treat their loans. Jessenia is 31 years old and lives with her father, a vegetable vendor, and her brother, who works as a driver. Jessenia sells perfume, make-up and everything realated to cosmetics from the Yanbal range through a catalogue. She also works as a dressmaking assistant where she sells her products to her colleagues and clients. This is the fourth loan that Jessenia is applying for. What she likes most is the educational service that the Foundation provides, with information about topics such as cancer that she did not know about before. With the loan that she obtains she will buy more Yanbal products, including creams, perfumes, eyeshadow, lipsticks and more cosmetics to fulfill the orders of her clients in Manabí and the local area.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase creams, perfumes, eyeshadow, lipsticks and other cosmetics

loans.name: Janeth Ernestina

texts.es:
La señora Janeth forma parte de las socias del banco comunal Fe y Progreso en la ciudad de Portoviejo,  nuestra socia vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Portoviejo  a unos pocos minutos en una  ciudadela de pocos habitantes.

Janeth está casada hace 15 años,  su esposo es  chofer de un taxi   y tienen tres  hijos  que aún son estudiantes; nuestra socia es vendedora ambulante por lo que  debe compartir su tiempo entre su negocio y las quehaceres del hogar,   por lo que sale muy temprano junto a  sus hijos   para aprovechar mientras ellos estudian ella visita a sus  clientes recorriendo  todo su sector y los alrededores ofreciendo ropa como medias, interiores, batas, tollas, blusas, y sabanas a crédito, lleva seis  años realizando esta actividad, Janeth se encarga de realizar las ventas y su esposo la ayuda con los cobros.

Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar pantalones, blusas, interiores y medias para toda la familia  y así  abastecer su negocio para la temporada navideña  ya que existe mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Janeth is a member of the Faith and Progress Community Bank in the city of Portoviejo. Our member lives in the outskirts of the city of Portoviejo, a few minutes away, in a small town with a few inhabitants. Janeth has been married for fifteen years. Her husband is a taxi driver. They have three children that are students. Our member is a traveling salesperson because she has to divide her time between her business and housework. She leaves the home early with her children in order to take advantage of the time when her children are studying. She travels around visiting her customers that all live in her area or the neighboring areas. She sells clothes on credit such as socks, underwear, gowns, towels, blouses and sheets. She has been doing this business for six years. Janeth does the selling and her husband helps her buy her supplies. With this loan she will buy pants, blouses, underwear and socks for the whole family and thus stock up her business for the time around Christmas when there is a larger demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, socks and underwear for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada con 5 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Yapura, no tuvo la ocasión de estudiar.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar redes para realizar la pesca artesanal, sus productos son comercializados en la plaza de Capachica.  También se dedica a la chacra.

Su mayor deseo es dar a sus hijos estudios para que sean profesionales y continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones, las charlas y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Dionicia is a member of the “Juchuy Niño” village bank, located in the Capachica district, Puno Province, Puno department. She is 43 years old, married with 5 children, and lives in the community of Yapura. She did not have the chance to study.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian women's rights organization) since the founding of her village bank. Her initial loan was for PEN 300, which allowed her to increase her capital for her fish-selling business.

Now she needs a new loan of PEN 600, which will allow her to buy nets for traditional fishing. She sells her products in the city square of Capachica. She also works on a farm.

Her greatest wish is to continue working and to help her children study so that they can be professionals.

She enjoys the meetings, chats and savings at her bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nets for traditional fishing

loans.name: Letty Yorlita

texts.es:
La señora Letty V. es socia del Banco Comunal de Jave Jireh en Portoviejo.  Las socias de éste banco son muy cristianas y dedicadas a sus trabajos.  Portoviejo es la capital provincial de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador.  La provincia es conocida por su  gastronomía (mariscos) y la Ruta del Sol con sus  hermosas playas.

Letty tiene 42 años y tiene 4 hijos de 7, 12, 18 y 23 años de edad.  Su esposo, Benito Ruiz  es un obrero en Portoviejo.  Ellos tienen su casa propia en la Ciudad  La Fátima.  Ella es costurera de ropa deportiva dese hace 15 años y su hijo les ayuda con la venta a sus amigos en el colegio. Debido a  la crisis financiera del mundo sus ventas han reducido un poco y para resolver ese desafío, ella ha empezado con la costura de ropa para fiestas como vestidos para  quinceañeras y otros compromisos.

 Con el crédito solicitado  ella va a comprar materiales como telas, encajes, hijos, cierres, etc.  para la confección de sus prendas  de vestir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Letty V. is a member of the communal bank Jave Jireh in Portoviejo. The members of this bank are all Christian and dedicated to their work. Portoviejo is the provincial capital of Manabi on the Ecuadorian coast. The province is known for its food (seafood), and la Ruta del Sol, with its beautiful beaches.

Letty is 42 years old, and has four children who are 7, 12, 18, and 23 years old. Her husband, Benito Ruiz, is a worker in Portoviejo. They have their own house in the city of La Fátima.

She has been sewing athletic clothes for 15 years, and her son helps her to sell to his friends at school. Due to the world-wide financial crisis, her sales have been down a little. To overcome this challenge, she has started to sew clothing for parties, like dresses for quinceañeras (coming of age celebrations) and other events.

With the loan she requested, she will buy materials like fabric, lace, thread, zippers, etc. to make her clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, lace, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady C. est une femme mariée, elle est âgée de 24 ans et membre du Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle fait de la transformation et vende de pâte d'arachide, elle vend également des tissus importés. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de s'équiper et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Madame Khady C. is 24 years old, married, and has been a member of the Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 for five and a half years. She processes and sells peanut butter, and she also sells imported fabrics. The profit she generates allows her to buy equipment and provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her business

loans.name: Rosita Maria

texts.es: Rosita es una socia muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 38 años, es madre de dos hijos menores. Ella tiene una bodega en su casa,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al transporte público. Rosita forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace un año y cuatro meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la cuota inicial de su congeladora para mantener sus productos en buen estado. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 que será utilizado en la compra de productos comestibles  para su bodega (fideos, arroz, conservas, azúcar, etc.). La meta de Rosita es construir su casa .
texts.en:
Rosita is a collaborative woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 38 years old, and the mother of two dependent children. She has a grocery store in her house, and has the help of her husband, who works in public transportation.

Rosita has been part of the communal bank "Juntas hasta el final" (Together to the end) for a year and four months. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which she used for a down payment on a freezer to keep her products in good condition. Now she needs a loan of 1000 soles that she will use to buy food items for her grocery store (noodles, rice, preserved food, sugar, etc.)

Rosita's goal is to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items for her grocery store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltera sin hijos, vive Capachica, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de venta  de salchimote (comida típica).

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar insumos para la preparación de comida al paso (maíz, condimentos, papa, pollo, combustible) los vende diariamente en la plaza de capachica.  También se dedica a la venta de pescado en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda bien surtida.

A ella le  gustan  las charlas y los ahorros
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the district of Capachica in the Puno province, Puno. She is 28 years old, single without children. She lives in Capachica and has completed elementary level studies.
Juana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos since the inception of the communal bank. Her first loan of S/300.00 Nuevos Soles, allowed her to increase her working capital for her business selling ‘salchimote’ a local food dish.
At this time, Juana is requesting a new loan of S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, which she will use to buy cooking ingredients (corn, condiments, potatoes, chicken, gas). She sells food on a daily basis at the plaza in Capachica. She also sells fish at the weekly fairs.
Her greatest wish is to have a store with an assortment of products.
She likes the workshops and the savings offered by her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients (corn, condiments, potatoes, chicken, etc.)

loans.name: Estrellas De Mar Group

texts.es: Edith T. es la presidente de  la asociación “Estrellas de Mar” del centro Focal Villa Exaltación, ella al igual sus compañeras, desea iniciar un negocio propio, el cual le permita  llevar el sustento a su familia, Edith desea abrir una sala de Internet, ya que este negocio se esta haciendo cada vez mas rentable, afirma. Ella necesita capital para iniciar su negocio. sus compañeras trabajaran con distintos negocios por ejemplo Juana venderá ropa, Jennifer tarjetas de cumpleaños, Inés reciclara papel y chatarras, Flora y Rosmery elaboraran comida, Marcos se dedica  a la costura de calzados. La asociación en su totalidad necesita capital para iniciar sus negocios compraran  mercadería e insumos.
texts.en:
Edith T. is the president of the “Estrellas de Mar” group, which is part of the Villa Exaltación regional office. Like her colleagues, she wants to start her own business so that she can support her family. Edith wants to open an Internet café since, as she explains, this business is becoming more and more profitable. She needs capital in order to start her business. Her colleagues work in different businesses—for example, Juana sells clothing, Jennifer sells birthday cards, Inés recycles paper and scrap metal, Flora and Rosmery prepare food, and Marcos earns a living making shoes. All of the members of the group need capital so that they can purchase merchandise and supplies in order to start their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for starting their businesses

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Isabel Cristina,  es una mujer que desde hace quince años se dedica a la agricultura en los cultivos de piña, ya que su mamá le brindo una manzana de terreno para que lo trabaje y pueda mantener a sus hijos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta que es madre soltera y no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para poder  suplir todas la necesidades de sus hogar , con el préstamo lo va a invertir en fertilizantes e insumos ya que si aplica estos al cultivo , logrará tener una buena producción y un producto de calidad y sus utilidades le van a beneficiar para construir su vivienda . Los sueños de doña Isabel es poder apoyar siempre a sus hijos en sus estudios y brindarle un bienestar mejor y seguro. Agradece a Afodenic ya que a través de fondo Kiva son muchas las familias campesinas que lograr mejor sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel Cristina has been growing pineapple for 15 years. Her mother gave her a plot of land for her to work so that she could provide for her children. The greatest difficulty she faces is being a single mother, since she does not have the financial resources to meet all of her household needs.

This loan will be used to invest in fertilizers and supplies for her crops. She has experienced good production of high quality products. Her profits will go toward the construction of her house. Doña Isabel dreams of always supporting her children with their education and providing for their security and well-being. She thanks AFODENIC for making Kiva funds available to many farming families so that they can improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies for improving pineapple production

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 41 años, vive junto a su pareja y padre de sus 6 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia.
Siempre sonriente, se le ve cruzar su pueblo, juntamente con su esposo camino a sus chacras. Ellos tienen cultivos de café y plátanos y ambos trabajan arduamente, ya que Anita tiene el dominio de trabajar artesanalmente con mucha agilidad en cada uno de estos cultivos, puesto que lo realiza desde su infancia. A ella no le parece nada cansado, es más disfruta realizarlo y cuando comercializa sus productos se llena de mucha alegría, pues con ese dinero compra los comestibles y vestimentas para sus hijos. 
Ahora que sus hijos han crecido, empezaran a trabajar junto a sus padres en sus chacras de café, para repartir las ganancias y de ese modo ellos poco a poco adquieran sus propios terrenos.

Este es el tercer crédito de Ana con MFP y durante este tiempo como clienta ha cumplido tanto en sus pagos, como en su cargo de tesorera de su banco comunal, al que aprecia mucho.
 El dinero que ahora solicita lo  piensa utilizar en la compra de plantitas de café y fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of their six children. They have their own home. Always smiling, Ana travels with her husband across town to get to their farm. They work hard to maintain their coffee and banana crops. Ana utilizes traditional methods, inspecting each of her crops by hand with great agility. She has been doing this type of work since childhood. Ana does not appear to be tired of her job; she enjoys it most during harvest season when she can bring her products to market. At that time, she generates income to buy groceries and clothing for her children. Now that her children are older, she has started helping her parents with their coffee crops. She hopes to share some of her earnings with them so they can gradually acquire their own land.

This is Ana’s third loan with MFP. During her time as a client, she has completed all of her payments. She also deserves much appreciation for her service as the Communal Bank treasurer. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase coffee seedlings and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & coffee seedlings

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 46 años, está casada y es madre de 6 hijos.
Desde hace 11 años viene trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes situado en su misma vivienda. Este negocio es muy concurrido, especialmente por sus vecinos, pues está en la parte alta del pueblo. Angélica ama su trabajo; por ello, muy temprano por la mañana alegremente va barriendo y ordenando sus estantes, ya que le gusta que estén limpios y atractivos.
La consigna de doña Angélica es “no cerrar”, de tener que realizar las compras prefiere encargarle a su esposo, mediante  una lista y como él tiene un carro, no gasta en transporte, así evita cerrar su tienda y perder ventas. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que hace el compromiso de pagar en las fechas señaladas todas sus cuotas, asimismo ha juramentado como la presidenta de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de más productos comestibles para su negocio.
texts.en:
Angélica is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. For 11 years, she has worked in the grocery store located in her home. Her business is very busy, frequented mostly by neighbors since it is located in the upper part of town. Angélica loves her job, which explains why she can be found in her store early in the morning cheerfully sweeping and organizing shelves. She likes everything to be clean and attractive. The sign in front of her store says “Never Closed”. Therefore, she leaves her husband in charge of securing merchandise by providing him a list of the products she needs. He brings back the supplies in his car in order to save on shipping costs. Doña Angélica never closes her shop to avoid the risk of losing sales.

This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to making her payments on the established due dates. In addition, Angélica was recently sworn in as president of her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be used to purchase more food products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye N. est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle développe une activité commerciale: elle vend des tissus et du café Touba (une boisson locale) Elle soutien son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ndèye N. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She is building a business selling fabrics and Touba coffee (a local drink) She helps her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for her business selling cloth and drinks

loans.name: Bettsy

texts.es:
Bettsy es una jovial madre de 23 años, vive con su pareja en la casa de su madre. 
Anteriormente apoyaba a sus padres con sus cultivos de café y plátanos, pero desde que formó su propia familia, se dedica a la compra y venta de plátanos juntamente con su esposo. Dos veces por semana madrugan para comprar sus plátanos en chacras que están bien alejadas, pues ahí los encuentran a un precio bajo y así les resulta más rentable porque al llegar al pueblo los venden a un menor precio y también los llevan a la capital de su región donde obtienen mejores ganancias. 
Para el futuro, desean compra su propio terreno, donde puedan construir su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, Bettsy se siente muy agradecida, ya que su préstamo anterior le permitió iniciar su negocio y con éste incrementará su capital.
texts.en:
Bettsy is a happy mother who is 23 years of age. She and her partner live at home with her mother.

Bettsy previously helped her parents with their coffee and banana crops. Now that she has her own family, she buys and sells bananas along with her husband. Twice a week, they leave early to buy fruit directly from the banana farms since they are located a considerable distance from where they live. They are able to obtain their products at a low price, which makes them more profitable when they take them into the regional capital where they can generate better revenues. In the future, Bettsy and her husband want to buy their own land so that they can build a house and improve their quality of life.

This is her second loan with MFP. Bettsy is very grateful for her previous loan, since it enabled her to start her business. The money from this loan will be used to increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her operating capital for buying & selling bananas

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo A. Rodríguez, es un productor de la zona rural del municipio de Ticuantepe, desde hace  treinta años se dedica a la agricultura, el inicio gracias al apoyo que recibió de sus padres los cuales le enseñaron a trabajar diferentes cultivos, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta que no cuenta suficiente recursos para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivo ya que estos son diversificados, estos productos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos para la mejora del mismo , don Arturo tiene siete hijos ya todos independientes y dos de ellos trabajan con el , la esposa trabaja como comerciante en el mercado Oriental de la capital de Managua para poder cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar como: agua, luz entre otros. Comprara abono para mejorar la producción.
texts.en:
Señor Arturo A. Rodríguez is a farmer in the rural area of the municipality of Ticuantepe. For 30 years he has worked in agriculture; he began this work thanks to the support that he received from his parents, who taught him to cultivate various crops. The main difficulty that he faces is that he does not have enough resources to adequately maintain his various crops; he lacks fertilizers and supplies to improve his crops. Don Arturo has 7 children; they are all independent and 2 of them work with him. His wife works as a trader in the Oriental market in the capital city of Managua in order to cover the basic household expenses such as water and light, among others. He will buy fertilizer to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to be applied in the cultivation of pineapples

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 34 años, está casada y es madre D. 7 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia. 
En los años anteriores, junto a su esposo sembraron café y plátanos en sus propias chacras, y ahora sólo se dedican a quitar la maleza, abonar y fumigar. Cada 15 días cosecha los plátanos y los venD. desD. su misma chacra, pero en el caso del café tiene que esperar 12 meses para la cosecha. Mientras ese tiempo trabaja en otras chacras, donD. inicia sus labores a las 8 D. la mañana hasta las 5 D. la tarD., por ese trabajo le pagan 12 soles diarios y a su esposo 13 soles. 
Con estas ganancias vienen supliendo las necesidades del hogar, y auque suele sentirse muy cansada, continúa porque no quiere que sus hijos pasen necesidad D. comida, ni mucho menos D. sus útiles escolares.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que vuelve a comprometerse a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas para que su banco comunal siga confiando en ella. El dinero que ahora requiere lo invertirá en la compra D. fertilizantes químicos, con los piensa abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 34, married, and has seven children. She lives with them in her own house. In previous years, she and her husband planted coffee and bananas on their own fields. Now, they only weed, fertilize, and fumigate. Every 15 days they harvest the bananas and sell them from their own farm. But, in the case of the coffee, they need to wait 12 months for the harvest. During this time she works on other farms, where she works from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. They pay her 12 PEN daily; they pay her husband 13 PEN. They use these earnings to supply the household necessities. Although it is very tiring, she continues because she does not want their children to lack food or their school supplies. This is her third loan with MFP. She renews her promise to make all of her payments on time so that her communal bank will continue to trust her. She will use the money that she is now asking for to buy chemical fertilizers, which she will use to fertilize her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, en su casa propia. Anteriormente trabajaba con los niños de su pueblo en un programa educativo del gobierno, pero para este año no la volvieron a contratar. En vista de ello, empezó a trabajar junto a su esposo en sus chacras de café y plátanos. El plátano es una fruta que ellos cosechan dos veces por semana y lo veden desde su misma chacra a los comerciantes que los visitan. 
Para Jesusa, los trabajos agrícolas no son complicados, pero quiere dedicarse a la compra y venta de plátano, pues así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para su hogar. Por este motivo, se esmera en tener limpias de arbustos sus chacras de plátanos, pues entre más produzca podrá vender más de sus propios productos y comprará menos a otros agricultores.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, en todas las reuniones de su banco comunal asiste junto a su esposo, ya que a él le gusta estar enterado y participar con sus ideas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de plátanos y café.
texts.en:
Jesusa, 34, lives with her life partner and the father of her three children in her own house. She previously worked with the children of her village in a governmental educational program. But, they are not going to hire her again this year. In light of this, she started working with her husband in their coffee and banana fields. Banana is a fruit, which they harvest two times a week. They sell it from their own farm to the merchants who visit them. To Jesusa, the farming work is not complicated. She wants to devote herself to buying and selling bananas. That is the way she can get greater earnings for her household. That is the reason she carefully clears her banana fields of shrubs. The more she produces the more of her own products she will be able to sell. Then she will buy less from other farmers. This is her third loan with MFP. She attends all of her communal bank meetings with her husband. He likes to be informed and participate with his ideas. She will use the money she is asking for to buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize her banana and coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 8 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos, estudio educación primaria incompleta.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 5 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de sacos de polietileno.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar sacos de polietileno, los cuales los utiliza para embolsar el yeso que la socia elabora, también se ayuda con la elaboración de artesanías.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para generar sus propios ingresos.
A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank "Juchuy Niño" (Juchuy Boy) located in the Capachica district of Puno Province, in the Department of Puno. Isabel is 49 years-old, married, and has 8 children. She lives in the community of Ccotos. She did not complete her primary education. Isabel has been working with the Movimiento Manuela R. for 5 years. Her initial loan was 300 Nuevos Soles, which she used as capital for her business selling polythene plastic bags. Currently Isabel needs a new loan of 1700 Nuevos Soles, which would allow her to purchase more polythene plastic bags, which she uses to package the plaster that she also produces. The plastic bags are also useful in the manufacture of craft products. Isabel's greatest wish is to continue working to earn her own income. She likes the meetings of the communal bank and the convenience the loans provide.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of polythene (plastic) bags for retail sale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 59 años, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su pareja en su casa propia.
Por más de 34 años se viene dedicando a labrar sus chacras de café y plátanos y en todo este tiempo realizó este trabajo en compañía de su esposa, pues junto, el trabajo por muy pesado, se torna más ligero. A  Manuel le gusta ocuparse en las labores agrícolas,  por ello siempre se adelanta, mientras que su esposa le da el alcance con él almuerzo. De sus dos cultivos, el preferido es el café, ya que en la cosecha le permite captar buena cantidad de dinero, y con estas ganancias recién puede hacer alguna inversión económica. 
Para esta temporada tiene pensado incrementar sus cultivos de café, para que con esas ganancias termine de pagar la carrera superior a su hijo.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y durante todos sus préstamos anteriores demostró ser un cliente muy cumplido en los pagos y en las reuniones de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Manuel is 59, and he has four children. He lives with his life partner in his own house. For over 34 years he has been working his coffee and banana fields. In all of that time he has worked with his wife. Together, the very heavy work becomes lighter. Manuel likes doing the farming work. He always works ahead while his wife prepares the lunch. Of his two crops, he prefers the coffee. This harvest allows him to get more money. With his recent earnings he is able to make some economic investment. For this season he is planning on increasing his coffee crops. With these earnings he will finish paying for his son’s post high school career education. This is his third loan with MFP. During all of his previous loans he demonstrated himself to be committed to making his payments and to his communal bank’s meetings. He will use the money he is asking for to buy chemical fertilizers and fertilize his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Ríos, tiene 31 años de edad, desde hace diez años labora como comerciante en el mercado Huembes, habita en un barrio pobre del municipio de Ticuantepe, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder ver construida su vivienda, ella con sus propios esfuerzos y el de su esposo ha construido gran parte de su casa , en una ocasión se le metieron a robar por las mimas condiciones que no es segura , con este financiamiento va a comprar materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento y las puertas de la misma , ella tiene tres hijos de dos, cuatro y ocho años , los sueños de la señora es poder darle estudios a sus pequeños y seguridad para que pasen por todas las dificultades que ella a enfrentado . Agradece a la institución por la confianza que le brinda en su primer crédito  ya que son muchas las familias que se beneficia y lograr optar por un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Maria Ríos, 31, has worked as a businesswoman in the Huembes market for over ten years. She lives in a poor neighborhood in the Ticuantepe municipality. The biggest difficulty she faces is not being able to see her house built. With their own efforts, she and her husband have built a big part of her house. One time people entered the house to rob it because it is not secure. With this loan she will buy construction materials like sand, cement, and cement doors. She has three children; two, four, and eight years old. Her dream is to be able to give her little ones an education. She also wants to give them security so that they do not have to face the same difficulties that she has had to face. She is grateful to the institution for the trust shown in giving her the first loan. There are a lot of families who benefit and are then able to achieve better well being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy windows, sand, and cement to tile her floor

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 58 años, es viuda y vive con uno de su hijo en su casa propia.
Al quedarse viuda sufrió mucho, sobre todo en las siegas del café, porque es un trabajo muy duro; desde la recolección, hasta el transporte de los sacos pesados. Pero ahora que creció su hijo vienen lidiando juntos con este trabajo. A diario madruga, levantándose a las 5 de la mañana, solo así se da tiempo para todas sus labores domesticas y para trabajar en sus chacras.
Manuela se ha dedicado toda su vida a las labores agrícolas y aprendió a trabajar con mucha y alegría con sus cultivos, con las expectativas de triunfar con ellos, pues como madre anhela que su hijo tenga una mejor educación.

Durante sus dos créditos anteriores no tuvo problemas de pago, y para este ciclo se compromete seguir la dinámica de trabajo en su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho cariño. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 58 year old widow. She lives with one of her children in her own house. She suffered a lot when she became a widow. She suffered the most with the coffee harvest. From collecting it to transporting it in the heavy sacks, it is very hard work. Now that her son has grown, they struggle together in this work. She gets up at five every morning. That is the only way that she has time for all of her domestic chores and to work in her fields. Manuela has devoted her whole life to the farming work. She has learned to work in her fields with much effort, happiness, and the expectations of triumph. As a mother, she longs for her son to have a better education. She did not have any problems paying the last two loans. For this cycle she promises to keep being dynamic in her work in her communal bank, for which has much affection. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 23 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su pequeña de 4 añitos, en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de primera necesidad, para ello cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, con quien hace dos años y medio acondicionaron un espacio de su vivienda apropiado y acogedor para su bodega. En el primer año fue difícil porque no vendía rápido sus productos y a veces se le malograban o se vencían, pese a esa dificultad siguieron adelante, ya que le agrada muchísimo esta actividad, porque le gusta hacer amigos y conversar. 
Hoy, gracias a su perseverancia, han ganado clientela y Mónica se esmera en darles una buena atención, ya que gracias a estos clientes su negocio sigue en pie.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se muestra muy agradecida, ya que estos créditos son de mucha ayuda. Con el dinero que ahora solicita incrementará los productos comestibles para surtir mejor su bodega.
texts.en:
Mónica, 23, lives with her life partner and father of her 4-year-old daughter in their own house. She sells basic food items. Her husband supports her efforts and together they arranged a part of their house to act as a welcoming and appropriate general store. The first year was very difficult because her sales were slow and sometimes her products would stay on the shelf beyond their expiration date or they would spoil. Despite this obstacle, they stuck to it because she loves this work because it allows her to make friends and chat. Today, thanks to her perseverance, she has acquired a steady clientele and Mónica takes great pains to provide good customer service because it is thanks to these customers that her business continues afloat. This is her third loan with MFP and she is most grateful because these loans are a big help. With the funds requested she will increase her stock of food items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 34 años, es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad. Clara  es costurera y también se dedica a la venta de comida, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la astilleria (constructor). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace ocho años,  el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que lo invirtió en productos e insumos para vender comida, pues antes se dedicaba a este negocio.  En la actualidad Clara  necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que será utilizado  una parte para comprar telas, hilos, elásticos, para la confección de lencería y otra parte para la compra de una remalladora. La meta de Clara es tener un taller de costura bien implementado para seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Clara is a hardworking and active woman who lives in Pucallpa city, in the Ucayali region. She is 34 years old and the mother of 4 young children. Clara is a seamstress and also sells food. She has a supportive husband, who works in the shipyard doing construction and repairs. Clara has been part of "Juntas Hasta el Final" (Together Until the End) community bank for 8 years. Her first loan of 300 PEN was invested in products and supplies for selling food, her primary business at the time. Currently Clara needs a loan of 2,000 PEN that will be used to buy cloth, thread, and elastic for making lingerie. Another part of the loan money will be used to purchase a sewing machine. Clara's goal is to own a well-supplied sewing workshop so that she can continue to meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, thread and elastic for making lingerie; purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es una serena mujer de 31 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Anteriormente se dedicaba únicamente a sus  cultivos de café y plátanos; de los cuales, cada quince días realizaba sus cosechas de plátanos vendiéndolos desde su misma chacra, en esta rutina le propusieron que se dedique a la compra y venta de plátanos. Desde entonces en compañía de su esposo, compra los plátanos de las chacras una vez por semana y después los envían hacia los mercados de la ciudad, pero el resto de los días continúa trabajando en sus chacras. Rufina ama las tareas agrícolas, ya que gracias a ellas viene manteniendo cómodamente a sus hijos.
Ahora tiene propuesto incrementar sus cultivos de plátanos y de ese modo enviar a los mercados sus propios productos, sin la necesidad de comprar de otras personas.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, durante este tiempo, ser parte de un banco comunal ha sido una muy bonita experiencia para Rufina, pues los integrantes de su grupo son responsables en sus cuotas y no han tenido problemas de mora. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y plantitas de plátanos.
texts.en:
Rufina is a calm 31-year-old, who lives with her partner, the father of their three children, in their own home. She used to farm just coffee and bananas. Every two weeks she could harvest bananas and would sell them directly from her farmlands. It was suggested to her that she could become a banana merchant so, together with her husband, they began to buy bananas from neighboring farms once a week and would send them to tthe markets in the city to sell. The rest of the days she continues working her own lands. Rufina loves farming chores because she can support her children comfortably thanks to them. Her current plan is to increase the size of her banana plantations so that she can send her product to market without having to buy from third parties. This is her third loan with MFP. Rufina has enjoyed being part of a communal bank all this time very much because her group members are responsible with their repayments and haven't had any problems with lateness. The funds she is requesting now will be used to buy chemical fertilizers and banana seedlings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and banana plants.

loans.name: Celia Argentina

texts.es: La señora Celia Argentina S., cumplió 51 años,   desde hace veinte años se dedica a prestar sus servicios en el ramo de la belleza adomicilio , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que a pesar que trabaje día completo no tiene los recursos económicos necesarios para poder terminar de construir su vivienda ,con el financiamiento quiere comprar materia les de construcción como: arena, cemento,   ya que si logra terminarla en un futuro quiere poner su propio salón de belleza y poder estar mas al pendiente de sus hijos , por que cuando sale a trabajar tiene que pagar para que alguien le cuide a su hijos de cuatro años, doña Celia es madre soltera , el apoyo que recibe es sus dos hijos mayores que trabajan y estudian.
texts.en:
Celia Argentina S., 51, has been a beautician for the past 20 years. She goes door-to-door to attend to her customers. The greatest difficulty she has is that, despite working the entire day, she still does not have enough funds to be able to finish building her house. With the funds requested, she plans to buy building materials like sand and cement because, if she manages to finish it, her plan is to set up her beauty salon in her house so that she can be more watchful of her children because, presently, when she goes out to work she has to hire someone to look after her four children. Cecilia is a single mother and the little help she gets comes from her two oldest sons who work and study.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sand and cement to finish building her house.

loans.name: Esmelda Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora ESMELDA tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito Huanchaco de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  FUENTE DE VIDA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 4to de secundaria, La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos como talcos, cremas, colonias, perfumes, maquillaje, labiales, etc. Y con sus primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró cosméticos como labiales, talcos, cremas, perfumes, etc.  
Con este crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará también cosméticos como labiales, colonias, rubores, etc. 
Esmelda sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial en donde vender sus cosméticos con mayor frecuencia y facilidad.
texts.en:
Esmelda is 42 years old and lives in Huanchaco district in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She belongs to the Fuente de Vida (Fountain of Life) community bank. She went to school until the 4th level of secondary school and now buys and sells cosmetics such as talcum powder, lotion, cologne, perfume, makeup, lipstick, etc. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought cosmetics such as lipstick, powder, lotion, perfumes, etc. With this loan of 2,000 PEN she will also buy cosmetics (lipstick, cologne, blush, etc.). Esmelda dreams of renting a stand in the shopping mall where she can easily sell more cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics such as lipstick, cologne, blush, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 33 años, está casada y es madre de 4 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.
Desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, este negocio surge por iniciativa de su esposo y desde ese entonces ya no trabaja en sus cultivos porque todo el tiempo está dedicada a atender a su negocio, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta 10 de la noche diariamente. En todo este tiempo pudo captar y fidelizar clientes, tratándolos amablemente y trayendo todos sus pedidos para una determinada fecha, logrado ser el negocio más concurrido de su pueblo. Su meta es que su bodega esté bien implementada con productos comestibles, golosinas y gaseosas; para ello, los domingos junto a su esposo van de compras a la ciudad.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, durante todo este tiempo no tuvo dificultades de pago y para este préstamo promete seguir con la misma responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el incremento del capital de su negocio. Asimismo, comprará fertilizantes químicos para los cultivos de café de su esposo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 years old, married, and lives in her own house with her 4 children. For 14 years she has sold groceries and basic items. This business originated through the initiative of her husband, and ever since she no longer works in agriculture because she spends all of her time attending to the store each day from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. Over time she managed to capture and retain customers, treating them amicably and filling all of their orders on time and in this way becoming the most popular store in the town. Her goal is to supply her store with food items, candy and soft drinks; to do this she will go with her husband on Sundays to make purchases in the city. This is her third loan with MFP, and during all of this time she has not had any difficulties making her payments. With this loan she promises to continue with the same responsibility. The money that she requests will be invested in increasing the inventory of her business, and she will also buy chemical fertilizers for her husband's coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús A. Ramírez es casado con la señora Claudia Martina Balbuena, son padres de familia de 2 hijos pequeñitos, el labora para un empresa como albañil desde hace 3 años, aparte obtiene ingresos extras ya que realiza trabajos por fuera, porque las personas lo buscan para que les realice construcciones y mejoras en su vivienda. El y su esposa están tramitando este crédito para la ampliación de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor Jesús A. Ramírez is married to Señora Claudia Martina Balbuena; they are parents of 2 small children. He has worked for a company as a bricklayer for 3 years, and also earns extra income doing outside jobs, because people look for him to do construction and improvements on their homes. He and his wife are taking out this loan to add on to their house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add on to their house

loans.name: Norma Aracely

texts.es: La señora Norma Aracely Pérez es casada y madre de familia de 2 niños, su papa vive con ellos y todos apoyan para los gastos del hogar, son una familia muy unida. Su esposo labora para una empresa desde hace 3 años y la señora Norma Aracely tiene su negocio propio de venta de ropa usada establecido desde hace 2 años, el cual esta creciendo ya que cuenta con buen producto para su clientela, por tal motivo esta tramitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía para su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma Aracely Pérez is married and the mother of two children. Their father lives with them and all contribute to meet household expenses; they are a very united family. Her husband has been employed by a company for the last 3 years and Norma Aracely has had her own business selling second-hand clothing for the last 2 years. Her business has been steadily growing because she has good quality product for her customers. This is the reason behind her request for funds: to buy more merchandise to add to her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna es una mujer muy serena de 39 años, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, siendo la suya, la tienda más concurrida de la parte baja del pueblo. Cada día, antes de abrir su negocio limpia y ordena sus mostradores, con este dinamismo pudo captar su clientela y acumular las ganancias que le han permitido ir surtiendo su tienda con abarrotes, verduras, herramientas del campo como machetes y hachas. Pero lo que no tiene son medicamentos de primeros auxilios, y muchos de sus vecinos cuando están enfermos acuden hasta la ciudad por enfermedades sin mayor complicación. Por ello, Digna está muy motivada en vender medicamentos, pero quiere capacitarse acerca de ellos para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que para este préstamo le va permitir progresar. Con el dinero que solicita comprar esos medicamentos básicos necesarios, así como un estante adecuado para ellos.
texts.en:
Digna is a calm, 39-year-old, married mother of two children. The family lives in their own house. For the past 6 years she has sold basic food items and her store is the busiest in the lower part of town. Every day, before opening up for business, she cleans and arranges her counters. This dynamism helped her capture customers and accumulate profits that have allowed her to stock her store with groceries, vegetables, field tools like machetes and axes. But what she does not have available is first-aid medicines and many of her neighbors must go into the city when they are suffering some minor ailment. This is why Digna is motivated to stock basic medicines but she wants to be trained in their proper use first so that she can provide good service to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time because this loan will allow her to progress. With the funds she plans to buy the necessary basic medicines and a proper display case for them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy laboriosa y madre de 4 hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia.
Hace dos años se inició en la venta de comestibles y verduras, de entonces está muy evocada a su tienda, pues poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus productos comestibles. Ocuparse de su negocio le gusta muchísimo; por ello, a pesar de que trabaja en la chacra de plátanos con su esposo, temprano regresa para atender a sus clientes, ya que logra obtener ganancias adicionales para su hogar. 

Su mayor dificultad en este momento es que no cuenta con dinero suficiente para surtir su negocio, es por ello que acude a este crédito, pues con el dinero que solicita surtirá su tienda con mayores productos; especialmente de comestibles y golosinas.

Siendo este su primer préstamo con MFP, tiene muchas expectativas positivas acerca de su banco comunal. Pero también hace el juramente de cumplir los pagos de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Hilda, 33, is a very hard-working woman and the mother of 4 children; she lives with her partner in their own house. Two years ago she began to sell food items and vegetables. Since then she has become increasingly focused on her store and little by little has been increasing the items she stocks. She really enjoys tending to her store. So, on top of helping her husband with his banana plantations, she comes back home early to tend to her customers because this produces additional income for her home. Her greatest difficulty at the moment is not having sufficient funds to stock her store. This is the reason for requesting this loan, to stock her store with a wider variety of items, especially food items and sweets. Because this is her first loan with MFP, she has high expectations of her communal bank but she also pledges to be punctual with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Ivo

texts.es:
Ivo es un hombre muy responsable de 44 años, está casado con la madre de sus 3 hijos.
Desde hace 24 años siembra café y plátanos en sus propias chacras y durante todo este tiempo sus cultivos le han resultado muy rentables, lo cual le permitió brindarles las comodidades necesarias a sus hijos. 
Él trabaja desde la 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, siempre en la compañía de su esposa, pero cuando cosecha los plátanos generalmente madruga, ya que a las 6 de la mañana, su comprador pasa a recoger el producto a su chacra, esta labor la realiza una vez por semana, llegando a vender cerca de 1500 kilos de plátano. 
Para la cosecha de café sus hijos se suman a la recolección, porque Ivo y su esposa lleven el grano cosechado a las acopiadoras de la ciudad y por ello se necesitan de varias manos para la cosecha.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Asimismo, jura guiar correctamente a su banco comunal, por ha sido elegido presidente de la junta directiva. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abona sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ivo is a very responsible 44-year old man who is married to the mother of his 3 children. For 24 years he has grown coffee and bananas on his own fields, and during this time his crops have been very profitable, allowing him to provide the necessities of life for his children. He works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening, always in the company of his wife, but when he harvests the bananas he generally gets up at dawn, since at 6 in the morning his buyer comes to collect the products from his farm. He carries out this work one time per week, and sells about 1500 kilos of bananas. For the coffee harvest his sons join in the picking, because Ivo and his wife take the harvested product to the buyers in the city, and for this reason they need extra hands for the harvest. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is committed to making all of his payments on time. Also, he pledges to properly lead his communal bank, because he has been elected president by the board. With the money he requests he will buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.
Laboriosamente y con mucha agilidad trabaja en sus cultivos de café y plátanos, de este modo se da tiempo para trabajar como peón en las chacras de sus vecinos, donde le pagan 13 soles a ella y 15 soles a su esposo por el día. Si reciben contratas para quitar la maleza se levanta a las 4 de la mañana, prepara los alimentos y a las 8 de la mañana ya deben estar en las chacras. Por muy pesado que parezca esta labor, a Marcelina no le parece nada cansado, es más ama lo que hace. De ese modo obtiene el dinero que puede gastar independientemente con las necesidades de sus hijos y su madre anciana. 
Sus anhelos para el futuro son de incrementar sus siembras para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Es su tercer crédito con MFP y ratifica su compromiso a su banco comunal de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 34, lives with her husband and three children in her own home. Laboriously and with much agility she farms her coffee and banana plantations so that she can have time to also work as a paid laborer on her neighbors' farmlands. For this work she is paid 13 soles a day (her husband earns 15 soles a day). If they are hired to do weed removal she gets up at 4am, prepares the daily meals and must be on the farmlands at 8am. As heavy as the work might seem, Marcelina does not find it tiring, what is more...she loves what she does. This allows her to obtain money which she can spend independently on 'the needs of her children and her aged mother. Her dreams for the future are to enlarge her plantings to improve her family's quality of life. This is her third loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time. The funds will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.es:
Visitación es una mujer de 50 años, está casada y es madre de 6 hijos.
Hace tres años implementó su propio restaurante de platos típicos de la selva, en su misma vivienda, la cual está ubicada en la calle principal de su pueblo. La venta de comidas típicas no le ha resultado muy rentable durante los días de la semana, por ello prefiere preparar menús de casa y a diario vende cerca de 15 platos a 4 soles cada uno. 
Además, para tener más clientes, todos los días madruga para preparar los desayunos que ofrece, ya que a las 7 de la mañana los profesores (clientes más regulares) y otros visitantes, se deleiten con la sazón de doña Visitación.
Su restaurante se llama “Restaurante Ruht” y a ella le gusta mucho esta labor, más aun cuando sus comensales elogian sus comidas. Para los próximos meses se viene proyectando en arreglar su casa, con las miras a convertirla en una casa de hospedaje para turistas.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y la primera vez que es parte de un banco comunal, por lo que tiene muchas expectativas, además espera que todos los integrantes se comprometan a ser puntuales en sus pagos, como ella lo hace. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de madera, con la que mandará a confeccionar puertas para los cuartos de su hospedaje.
texts.en:
Visitación, 50, is married and the mother of 6 children. Three years ago she equipped her own eatery, where she serves dishes typical of the jungle region, in her home, which is located on the main street of her town. The sale of typical dishes has not proven to be very profitable during weekdays so she prefers to make daily home-made meals of which she sells about 15 daily at 4 soles each. In addition, to have more customers, every day she gets up at dawn to prepare the breakfasts she offers since teachers (her most regular customers) and other diners who love her cooking, come in at 7am. Her eatery is called "Restaurant Ruht" and she enjoys her work very much, more so when diners compliment her on her dishes. For the future she wants to remodel her house with the intention of turning it into a boarding house for tourists. This is her first loan with MFP and her first time as a member of a communal bank for which she has many expectations. She hopes that all the members will commit to be punctual with their repayments, as she is. The funds requested will be used to buy lumber with which to have doors made for her guest rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To convert her house into a boarding house.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D. is from the town of Calamba. She is 25 years old. Alma is married and has 1 infant children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting flowers for sale. Alma is just starting this business.

In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Alma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
La señora Perla L. L. ha sido muy buena clienta ha demostrado un buen historial crediticio. Con este préstamo seria el quinto, por lo que Perla les agradece el apoyo por que a podido realizar cada proyecto para mejorar su casa.  Donde vive no pasa el drenaje y para poder tener baño su esposo construyo una fosa séptica hace años en el que ahora necesita una reparación.
Perla es madre de tres hijos por lo que no quiere que la fosa antigua pueda causarles alguna enfermedad infecciosa por que la fosa esta al intemperie solo lo que la cubre es una tabla sobre puesta y lo que quiere hacer es ponerle una tapa de concreto  para que este mas reforzada.
texts.en:
Perla L. L. has been a good member and has a good credit history. This will be her fifth loan, and Perla is grateful for the support in helping her carry out all the improvement projects on her home. There is not a drainage system where she lives, and to be able to go to the bathroom there her husband built a septic tank years ago, and it now needs repairs. Perla is a mother of three children, and she doesn't want the old tank to make them sick or cause infections since it is out in the open with only a board over it. Perla wants to put a concrete lid on it that is stronger and more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair septic tank

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Rubén Gómez es un señor que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos y de su esposa es por ello que trabaja horas extras para darles una mejor calidad de vida. El ha ido construyendo su casa con prestamos de aquí y ahorros propios.
Ahora una de sus hijas ya esta grande en el que el le hizo un cuarto aparte para ella el que tenga su privacidad. Rubén  quiere que su hija se sienta bien en su nueva recama es por ello que quiere ponerle vitropiso para que se vea bonito y su hija se sienta orgullosa del padre que tiene.
texts.en:
Rubén Gómez is a gentleman who is concerned about the well-being of his wife and children, and it's for this reason he works extra hours to give them a better quality of life. He has been building his home with loans from here and personal savings. Now that one of his daughters is grown up, he built her a separate bedroom so that she could have some privacy. Rubén wants his daughter to feel comfortable in her new room, and it's for this reason he wants to put in ceramic tiles so it looks beautiful and so his daughter feels proud of him.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put cermatic tile flooring in his home

loans.name: Marta Teresa

texts.es:
Marta Juárez es una señora que desde cuatro años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y de comida. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante ante esta crisis es por ello que no se da por vencida. En su negocio tiene de todas tallas en ropa y de de paltillos que le guste a la gente como menudo los domingos, tamales, carne asada y taquitos de varios guisos.
Como su negocio no esta en un local con techo cuando son las lluvias las lonas que ella tiene no cubren todo es por ello que quiere comprar unas buenas tablas para que este bien protegida y también comprar mercancía para que en esta temporada navideña no le falte nada
texts.en:
Marta Juárez has made a living for the past four years selling food and used clothing. She is a very hard-working woman with a strong desire to make headway despite hardships, which is why she'll never give up. Her business has all kinds of clothes and foods that people enjoy, like menudo on Sundays, tamales, carne asada and various kinds of taquitos. Because the business isn't covered with a roof, when it rains the canvas she has doesn't cover everything, which is why she wants to purchase some good boards so it's better protected. She also plans to buy some merchandise for the Christmas season so she doesn't lack anything her customers want.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and some boards to cover the business

loans.name: Adialida

texts.en:
Adialida A. is from the village of Tru-caut, Sapng Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Adialida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Adialida raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Adialida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adialida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adialida is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the first loan taken out by Adialida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito C. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old. Juanito is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Juanito operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport. Juanito has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanito is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Juanito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet Y. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Juliet is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Juliet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa Y. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is a 59-year-old widow with one adult child. To make a living, Elsa raises pigs for sale and has been doing so for over 10 years. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Elsa joined GDMPC in 2006 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan of 7,000 PHP and is now requesting her fourth loan, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock. She hopes she will improve her living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Janes Ann

texts.en:
Janes Ann S. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Janes Ann maes and sells banana cue snack in the local community. Janes Ann has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Janes Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina F. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
