Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Amilo

texts.en:
Amilo R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions at the market, but she is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish to sell.  Amilo is 30 years old and married.  Her husband is a mechanic and they have five children who attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more materials and supplies to make clothing for sale

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 31 years old and is married with four children aged from 4 to 12 years old. Marie Claire is a proven entrepreneur! She has had her own shop selling a variety of goods since she was just 25 years old. She works long hours to make her store a success: the hours of her shop are from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Although Marie Claire has been in the business for six years, her capital reserves are still too low to allow her to expand her shop. She believes that a small amount would allow her to grow her enterprise through purchasing some new goods for sale such as beans, bananas, potatoes and various and sundry other goods. Her sense of the market is that her current customers will respond well to these new offerings and she may also attract new clients.

Marie Claire believes her strategy will be a profitable one and she is looking for funding. Marie Claire, a proven entrepreneur, is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods for her inventory

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes D. is a 25-year-old woman whose husband is a soldier at Bilpam. She has one young child who does not yet attend school.  Agnes runs a business selling used clothes and shoes. She started two years ago and unfortunately business is declining due to lack of customers.  That is why she is requesting a loan from BRAC southern Sudan, so she can stock bedsheets to sell. In the future, Agnes hopes to buy two sewing machines for designing bedsheets to sell.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Mrs. Elsie J. is from the village of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 adult children.To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector.

In 2008, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing business

loans.name: C5525 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Odette is a 38-year-old widow with four children, aged between 4 and 15 years.  Odette lives in the Western province of Rwanda where she is the president of a group called Twitezimbere. This group operates the business of wholesaling a wide variety of fruit. This is their 5th successful year in this business! The Twitezimbere group members work from 6 AM to 6 PM every day, except Sunday.

Twitezimbere is requesting its first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing more fruit for sale.  By buying in larger quantities from their suppliers, they should be able to secure better pricing as well. Through this expansion, they hope to attract many more customers as well as increasing their profit. With this profit, the members of this group hope that their lives will change for the better, progressively.  As they make more money through these efforts, they will be able to continue to pay school fees for their children and set aside some savings for their respective futures.

loans.use: More variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong C. sells onions and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan from Kiva through BRAC southern Sudan so she can purchase cooking oil to sell. Hong is married with three children who are all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children up through higher learning.  

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Mr. Victoriano E. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 67 years old. He is married and blessed with 5 adult children. He's a pensioner, having a monthly pension of 5,700 as his source of income. In 2009, he joined PMPC to access the programs and services of this Coop. Currently,he's applying for his 1st loan in the amount of 40,000 which will be used for house renovation.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Mrs. Gina P. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.

In 2008, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: ingredients to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Mrs. Leonila S. is from the town of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, is married, and blessed with three school-aged children. Leonila owns and operates a business selling of variety of food products in the local community. In 2005, Leonila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 30 years old, married with 4 children with ages between 1 and 8 years old. Angelique and her family live in the Western province of Rwanda, which is approximately three hours' drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Angelique is a proven entrepreneur owning a shop where she has been selling a variety of goods for several years. Her popular shop is open from 6 AM to 8 PM every day, except Sunday.

Angelique works hard to make a living for herself and her family. She is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing more and better quality goods at better prices in greater quantities in order to attract new customers and earn more profit. If her expansion plans are successful, Angelique hopes to do a lot for her family such as; paying school fees for her children and providing more food for them.

loans.use: A variety of goods/inventory

loans.name: Kayitesi

texts.en:
Kayitesi is 47 years old, married with 5 children, aged between 8 and 19 years old. Kayitesi is a proven entrepreneur, having started in business for herself many years ago. Her current business is selling fish--a successful business and one that employs 2 people. This is her 6th successful year in this enterprise. She and her two workers put in long hours; work starts at 6 AM and goes to 6 PM every day, except Sunday.

This is Kayitesi's first time requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more fish for sale. Kayitesi hopes that she will be able to buy in larger quantities and secure better pricing which will attract more customers and allow her to earn more profit. Any profit earned will help her and her devoted spouse to continue paying school fees and provide more and better food for her children (other than fish!) In addition, she will be able to build a more secure future for them.

loans.use: More fish for sale and additional working capital

loans.name: Fabrice

texts.en:
Fabrice is 26 years old, single, and he lives in the western province of Rwanda which is approximately three hours' drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. It is here that Fabrice operates his shop selling a variety of goods in his community. His shop has only been open since 2008 but it is doing well for a new business. A hard worker, trying to ensure his success, Fabrice starts his work day at 5 AM and finishes at 9 PM, every day except Sunday.

Fabrice is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his shop through purchasing some additional goods and inventory for sale. Fabrice hopes that with the additional goods, he will attract more customers to his shop, as there seems to be demand for these items he plans to purchase. If successful, Fabrice will reinvest any profits from this strategy into his business which he is trying build stronger in order to build a more secure future for himself and the family he hopes to have (someday!)

loans.use: More variety of goods/inventory for sale

loans.name: C4351 Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 49 years old, married with 2 children aged 19 and 23 years old. Jacqueline lives in Kimironko, which is in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.  Jacqueline is the president of a group called “Abanyamurava."  This group has successfully operated the business of selling clothes for two years. Today, Abanyamurava employs 2 people as helpers. The opening hours of the business are from 6 AM to 6 PM, every day except Sunday.

The members of this group are requesting their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their business in order to expand their business through purchasing a greater quantity and variety of clothes.  They expect that this will increase their monthly sales of clothing by attracting more customers.  This will (hopefully) bring them more profit. As the business grows and strengthens, they hope simply to take better care of their families.

loans.use: More quantity and variety of clothes for sale

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en: Kyalo K. operates a motorbike taxi. He provides taxi service to the staff of cooperatives in the local area and other walk-in clients. He has been in this business for the last 3 years.  Besides this he also does subsistence farming.  His business challenges are increasing fuel costs, a poor road network, and brake failures.  He is using the proceeds of KES 30,000 to buy another motorbike.  He is looking forward to opening a new station.  Kyalo is single and describes himself as hardworking and serious man.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento PICAFLOR Inicio fue fundado el 27 de Octubre del presente año. Estando bajo la direccion de la señora Shirley, socia muy activa, tanto en sus actividades economicas propias, como en las actividades de grupo;  quien tiene como actividad el comercio de ropa, vende en su propio domicilio; es casada con tres niños. La señora Ivonne se desempeña como tesorera, socia que gracias a ella se reunio el Banco;  se dedica a la venta de ropa en general; es casada tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar. El señor Cesar es el secretario de actas cuya actividad es la venta de ropa; el señor es divorciado, pero vive con dos de sus hijos.  Estas tres personas son la cabeza del banco de emprendimiento conformado por trece personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas ya que no cuentan con garantia personal para poder sacar un prestamo individual. Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio y ambulante y el otro 30% trabajan con negocio propio y fijo. Una gran mayoría no cuenta con domicilio propio, son padres y madres de familia muy trabajadores ya que el negocio es el único ingreso con el cuál mantienen sus hogares.
texts.en:
The startup bank PICAFLOR Inicio was founded October 27 of this year. It is under the direction of Sra. Shirley, a very active member in her own business as well as in the businesses of the group. Her business is in clothing, selling clothes from her own home. She is married with three children. Sra. Ivonne holds the role of treasurer and member, and thanks to her the Bank met. She sells clothing in general, and is married with 4 school-aged children. Sr. Cesar is the secretary, and his business is the sales of clothing. He is divorced, but lives with two of his children.

These three people are the head of the startup bank, made up of 13 people who guarantee between them since they cannot count on a personal guarantee in order to be able to take out an individual loan. A large majority have their own mobile business, and the other 30% work with their own fixed business. A large majority do not have their own home. They are very hard-working mothers and fathers, since their business is their only source of income with which they can maintain their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of capital

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal DIAMANTES está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona de Kupini Central, que están ubicados alrededor de la Cancha de futbol de Kupini, las socias se dedican a la venta de Comida, porcelana, atención de tienda, venta de pasankalla (pipocas), venta de frutas, venta de condimentos,  es una de las bancas que esta conformado por las socias mas antiguas. 
Rosalia,  es la líder y presidenta del banco, es una de las fundadoras del banco, teniendo en cuenta que el banco ya tiene como antigüedad 4 ciclos, la socia se dedica a la venta de frutas. En el mercado de kupini. Durante su permanencia, en su banco comunal ha aprendido a ser una líder exigente con sus cuotas de sus compañeras a la hora de pago, respetuosa con sus compañeras con el préstamo que se le ha otorgado a podido aumentar su capital en su puesto de venta de frutas y poder generar mayor ingreso económico para su familia.
Maria Luisa, la señora es la Tesorera del Banco es una de las que dio origen a la conformación del banco Diamantes se actualmente la socia vende objetos de porcelana en la plaza Eguino (zona central de la ciudad de La Paz), no contaba con capital para su actividad económica, sin embargo ahora con el préstamo que se le dará  ella podrá comprar  mas mercadería y así aumentar su capital y su estabilidad económica.
Jose, Socio que se integra a la banca es su segundo ciclo bastante dinámico, alegre, es la secretario del Banco, actualmente es chofer el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas para arreglar su  movilidad
texts.en:
The Diamantes Community Bank is made up of 10 customers who live in the Kupini Central Zone - located near the Kupini Soccer Field. These partneers work selling food, crockery, clothing, popcorn, fruit, and condiments. It is a bank with the most enduring partners. Rosalia, as leader and president of the bank, is one of the banks founders. The bank has existed for 4 cycles, and Rosalia works selling fruit in the Kupini market. During her term she has learned to be a leader who makes sure that participants make their payments. At the same time she is respectful of her companions, having been able to increase her capital in her fruit stand and bring additional income into her family. Maria Luisa is the treasurer of the bank, and one of founding members of the Diamantes bank. Currently, this partner sells crockery in the Eguino Plaza - located in the downtown area of the city of La Paz. She had not counted on capital for her economic activity, however, with the loan that she will receive she will purchase additional merchandise; increasing her capital and her economic stability. Jose, a partner who has joined the bank is in his second cycle. He is very dynamic, happy. He serves as the secretary of the bank, and is currently working as a driver. He will use this loan to invest in the purchase of tools to repair his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising working capital

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Señorita Alejandra , es soltera, ella hace un año que se dedica a la venta de Cds, a pesar de ser muy joven es una persona muy optimista y responsable ya que ella ha terminado la secundaria, ahora al dedicarse a la venta de CDs quiere reunir dinero para sus estudios en la universidad y asimismo colaborar en su hogar, ella vende en las diferentes ferias, en diferentes barrios, por ejemplo los dias jueves ella vende en la feria de Cumavi, una feria muy conocida en la Villa 1ro de mayo; en este momento ella necesita incrementar su mercaderia ya que en fin de año es cuando más venta tiene y desea surtir su negocio con  nuevas peliculas y Cds musicales, es por eso que accedio a un credito para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Ella se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza y esta muy contenta con las oportunidades que le brinda Emprender .
texts.en:
Ms. Alejandra is single and has worked for one year selling CDs. In spite of being very young she is a very optimistic and responsible person who has already finished her secondary education. She is now selling CDs because she wants to raise money for her studies at the university and at the same time work at home. She sells at different outdoor markets in different districts. For example, on Thursdays she sells at the Cumavi market, a well-known market in the town of Villa Primero de Mayo. At this point she needs to increase her merchandise because at the end of the year is when you want to increase sales and stock your business with new movies and music CDs. That’s why she agreed to a loan for increasing her working capital. She is very proud of the work she is doing and very happy with the opportunities that Emprender offers.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: El Sr. Cristobal hace 7 años que se dedica a la compra y venta de Cd`s musicales y peliculas en DVD, que envia a las provincias de Cochabamba a sus clientes que ya tiene, además se dedica a la venta de articulos para automoviles como forros, pisos, aros que distrubuye a los taxista del Radio Movil Agil, El Sr. Cristobal es padre soltero, puesto que su hijo de 7 años esta al cuidado de el, el niño asiste a primaria; El Sr. Cristobal viaja a Cochambamba por lo menos dos veces al mes para llevar mercaderia y cobrar lo dejado anteriormente; su sueño es poder comprarse su casa propia ya que actualmente vive en la casa de un amigo que se fue a trabajar a España, desea brindarle las mejores oportunidades a su hijo y es por eso que accedio a un credito para aumentar su capital de trabajo sobre todo por fin de año que es cuando más ventas tiene y gana mejor.Es cliente antiguo en la institucion y siempre ha sido muy responsable con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mr. Cristobal has worked for 7 years selling music CDs and movie DVDs to the Provinces of Cochambamba to customers that he already has. He also works in the sale of automobile parts such as linings, floors, and rings that he distributes to taxi drivers from Radio Movil Agil. Mr. Cristobal is a single father. Because his son is only 7 years old he is still caring for him. The boy attends primary school. Mr. Cristobal travels to Chocambamba at least twice a month to carry merchandise and charge for what he left earlier. His dream is to be able to buy his own home. Currently his is living in the house of a friend who went to work in Spain. He wants to provide the best opportunities for his son. This is why he is asking for a loan to increase his working capital now because the end of the year is when there are more sales and he can earn more. He is a long-term partner with the institution and has always been very responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia DOMINGA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, ella vive en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba.  
  
La socia tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija mujer que estudia la carrera profesional de Turismo. la socia es docente del nivel primario en el colegio “Sillabamba” del distrito de San Salvador.  

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la enseñanza en las mañanas y por las noches ella trabaja en su puesto de venta de comida al paso, vende salchipapas (comida Peruana con ingredientes: papas y salchichas) y pollipapas (comida Peruana con ingredientes como: papas, salchichas y pollo). Ya tiene varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone a su trabajo.      

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de comida al paso. 
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Domingo belongs to the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. She lives in the Calca district in the Urubamba province. She is a 50 year old single mother. She has a daughter who is studying for a professional career in tourism. She is a primary school teacher in the Sillabamba School in the San Salvador district. She alternates her activities between the home, teaching in the mornings, and in the evenings selling fast food from her stand. She sells “salchipapas” (Peruvian food with potatoes and sausages) and “pollipapas” (Peruvian food with ingredients like potatoes, sausages, and chicken). She has been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business of selling fast food. She is grateful to the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies like potatoes, sausages, and chicken to make her fast food

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
La socia MARIA JESUS pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, ella vive en el distrito de calca de La socia MARIA JESUS pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, ella vive en el distrito de calca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Calca esta a una hora de la provincia de Cusco. 
  
La socia es la presidenta del banco comunal. La socia tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, es docente del colegio “Sagrado Jesús de Calca”. 

Ella por las mañanas enseña en el colegio y por las tardes ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención del pequeño negocio de abarrotes donde vende víveres como azúcar, arroz, fideo, pan, gaseosas, etc. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone para en su trabajo.

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de comestibles.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María Jesús belongs to the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. She lives in the Calca district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. The city of Calca is an hour from the Cusco province. She is the president of her communal bank. She is a 49 year old single mother. She has two children. She is a teacher at the Sagrado Jesús de Calca School. She teaches in the mornings, and in the afternoons she alternates between her household chores and working in her small grocery business. She sells food like sugar, rice, noodles, bread, and soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business of selling food. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan. She promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more food like noodles, sugar, and rice, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mansata

texts.fr: Mansata B. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre su Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 depuis 3 ans et demi où elle a bénéficié de 7 prêts qu'elle toujours bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait du commerce de tissus teintés, elle s'approvisionne ici au Sénégal pour exporter sa marchandise en Espagne. Elle participe aux charges familiales et à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Mansata B. is a woman of 48 years. She is married and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of CENTRE2 for 3 and a half years, where she has benefitted from 7 loans that she always managed and reimbursed well. She sells dyed fabrics. She supplies herself here in Senegal and exports her merchandise to Spain. She shares the family expenses and helps to improve the living conditions of her offspring.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her business selling dyed fabrics

loans.name: Jahayra Elieth

texts.es: Jahayra Elieth de 32 años es soltera, no tiene hijos, es trabajadora de la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 3 años  y se desempeña como encargada del sistema informatico geografico de esta institucion. Esta solicitando su 5to credito para mejorar su casa comprando zinc, pues desea cambiar parte del techo de su casa (cocina) que se encuentra en mal estado, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de productos cosmeticos de AVON y ZERMAT a compañeras de trabajo y otra clientela que tiene, por lo que desea utilizar parte del credito para compra de los productos y surtir su pequeño negocio, pues obtiene ingresos adicionales que le permiten pagar sus gastos.   El mayor sueño de Jahayra es formar su familia y poder brindarle las condiciones basicas para vivir en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Jahayra Elieth is 32, single, and does not have children. She has worked for the mayor’s office in Juigalpa for three years. She is in charge of the geographical information system in this institution. She is asking for her fifth loan to improve her house. She will buy zinc because she wishes to change the roof on her house (in the kitchen), which is in bad shape. She also sells Avon and Zermat cosmetic products to colleagues at work and other customers that she has. She wants to use part of the loan to buy the products to stock her small business. She gets additional income that allows her to pay her expenses. Jahayra’s biggest dream is to form a family and be able to provide them with the basic conditions to live in a pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc and cosmetic products

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est divorcée et mère d'un enfant dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 dans lequel elle joue un rôle de leader. Elle y a reçu 11 prêts qu'elle a bien remboursés. Ce crédit lui servira à développer une petit unité d'élevage de poulets de chaire et parallèlement à commercialiser des effets vestimentaires tels que des tenues de dames. Ses bénéfices lui servent à assurer la prise en charge de son enfants.
texts.en:
Awa D. is a woman of 52 years. She is divorced and the mother of a child that she supports. She is member of the Village Bank of CENTRE2 in which she plays a leading role. She has received 11 loans there that she repaid well. This loan will be used to develop a small farm for raising chickens and also to market clothing such as ladies garments. Her profits serve to cover the costs of caring for her child.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a chicken farm

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es:
La socia RUTH MARINA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA. Ella vive en el distrito de calca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

La ciudad de Calca esta a una hora de la provincia del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos, el menor estudia en el colegio.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención del pequeño negocio de venta de repuestos y lubricantes de carros. Ya tiene vaR. años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone a su trabajo.   
 
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de repuestos. Ella va comprar accesorias empaquetaduras, pistones y sillones también va comprar lubricantes aceites, filtros, grasa, engrase y aditivos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member Ruth Marina belongs to the community bank "Virgen Asunta". She lives in the district of Calca in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. The city of Calca is one hour from the province of Cusco. The member is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children, the younger of which is studying in high school.

She alternates her household activities with attention to her small business of selling spare parts and car lubricants. She has been doing this work for several years, and it has been very good to her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work.

The member is requesting the loan to increase the capital in the business of selling spare parts. She is going to buy packing accessories, pistons, and seats. She is also going to buy lubricant oils, filters, grease, and additives. She is very thankful for the opportunity offered through these means, and she therefore commits to complete the corresponding payment according to the time line.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the capital of the business of sales of spare parts and lubricants, and buying more products

loans.name: Lidia Lucia

texts.es: Doña Lidia es muy buena cliente, viene trabajando junto a Emprender desde el año 2007 se encuentra atravesando la decimo sexta secuencia consecutiva, durante todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una mujer con ganas de superacion, ya que el trabajo que realiza es esforzado por que para realizarlo ella debe levantarse muy temprano debido a que el mercado donde ella vende se encuentra bastante lejos de su domicilio debiendo atravesar practicamente toda la ciudad.  Ella tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar para los cuales debe dejar todo listo para que los mismos puedan desayunar para luego dirigirse a la escuela.  La cliente invertira el dinero del credito en el pago de mano de obra del albañil que esta realizando dos pequeñas habitaciones en su domicilio, tambien comprara puertas para las misma, otra parte del credito destinara  para comprar abarrotes y asi surtir el puesto de desayunos del Mercado yungas.
texts.en:
Lidia is a very good client who has been working with the microfinance organization Emprender since 2007 and is going through the sixteenth consecutive sequence. During all this time she has shown herself to be a woman with a desire to improve herself, especially as her work requires a lot of effort because she has to get up very early due to the fact that the market where she sells is located quite a long way from her home and she has to cross practically the whole city to get there. She has four children of school age and she must leave everything ready for them so that they can have breakfast and then go to school. This client will use her loan to pay the mason who is building two small bedrooms at her house, and she will buy doors for the rooms. Another part of the loan will be used to buy groceries to supply the breakfast place in the Yungas market.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay a mason and to increase the supplies for her business

loans.name: Yenis Gezabel

texts.es:
la sra. Yenis Gezabel L. V. tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y se dedica a la venta de refrescos de cola, tiene poco tiempo de haber inicado con su negocio, Yenis no tiene mucho capital para comprar los refrescos y esta comprando poco producto, el carro que reparte los refrescos solo pasa una vez a la semana ya que vive en un lugar retirado de la ciudad, por eso es que necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos y asi tener producto siempre ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son muchas. Yenis L. vive en la aldea Tapones y este lugar es muy caliente.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz y que de ahora en adelante todo le va a salir bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yenis Gezabel L. V. is 39 years old, married, and she sells cola soft drinks for a living. She started her business a short time ago. Yenis does not have much capital to buy the pops and she is buying small amounts. The pop distributing vehicle only comes by once a week as she lives far from the city and therefore she needs the loan to buy more soft drinks and always carry stock as her customers are very demanding. Yenis Laines lives in the village Tapones, a place with a very hot climate. She comments to us that she is very happy and that from now things are going to go well.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tzamcotom Group

texts.es: El grupo D. Tzancotom, han trabajado desD. 6 años atras en la compra y venta D. ropa tipica y viendo la necesidad para incrementar sus mercaderia y sus ventas acudieron a la asociaciòn ASDIR para apoyarles en su capitalizaciòn y ellas expònen que son mujeres trabajadoras y se dedican al comercio ya que D. eso depenD. D. sus sustento cotidiano y D. su familia para eso quieren incrementar sus ventas y tener mejores condiciones D. vida para ellas y D. sus hijos tamiben como ellas dicen mejor es seguir luchando para alcanzar sus sueños que se hagan realidad y el deseos màs granD. es dejas las casas infrahumanos y cosntruir una casa apropiada y sobre salir D. esas condiciones D. pobreza.-
texts.en:
The Tzancotom group has worked for 6 years buying and selling typical clothing and because of the need to increase merchandise and sales they have approached ASDIR for support in capitalization and they state that they are hard-working ladies dedicated to sales for theirs and their family's daily necessities and therefore they need to increase sales and obtain better living conditions for themselves and their children. As they say it is better to continue the struggle to reach their dreams and their most important wish is to leave their poor houses and build appropriate dwellings and be able to leave behind the conditions of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Leticia Dennise

texts.es: La señora Leticia es una cliente nueva en la institución, es hermana de una cliente que trabaja en Banco de emprendimiento. La señora Leticia se dedica principalmente a la reparación de celulares y también a la venta de accesorios para celulares desde hace dos años. Su esposo, el señor Freddy, es empleado en una fábrica de textiles que queda en la zona de Villa Fátima. Ellos tienen dos pequeños hijos a los cuales crían con mucho cariño y dedicación. Viven en una casa de alquiler en  la Avenida Cuidad del Niño de la zona de Pampahasi. La señora Leticia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vitrina nueva, y otros accesorios para celulares. Uno de los principales anhelos de la señora Leticia es poder ampliar su negocio y así con el tiempo poder ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs Leticia is a new client to the institution, she is the sister of a client who works at the Bank of entrepreneurship. For two years doña Leticia has been repairing and selling accessories for mobile phones for a living. Her husband, don Freddy, is an employee at the textile mill in the area of Villa Fátima. They have two young children who they care for with love and dedication. They live in a rented house in Avenida Ciudad del Niño, in the area of Pampahasi. Mrs. Leticia requests the loan to buy a new showcase and other accessories for the cell phones. One of her main goals is to be able to expand her business and with time be able to save enough to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of showcase, chargers, batteries, frames, and flash memories

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
la sra. Luisa C. S. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad. sus tortillas las vende en diferentes casas, mercaditos y pulperias de la Aldea Tapaire, Choluteca.
sus tortillas se venden muy bien ya que tienen un buen sabor, este tipo de comida se consume bastante en estos lugares, las tortillas son el complemento ideal para todos los platos del dia.
tambien hace por encargos para reuniones.
Luisa necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas ya que ahora las ventas son mas grandes y no se da abasto para complacer a todos sus clientes.
Luisa en un futuro desea contratar a alguien para que le ayude en su produccion y reparticion de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa C. S. makes and sells tortillas for a living, she has a lot of experience as she sells her tortillas to different establishments, markets, and general stores at the Aldea Tapaire, Choluteca. Her tortillas sell very well as they are good tasting and this type of food is very popular in those areas as the tortillas go with any kind of dish. She also makes on demand for special events.

Luisa needs the loan to buy more raw material to make the tortillas as sales are increasing and she cannot meet her customers' demands. For the future Luisa wants to hire somebody to help with the production and delivery of the tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn flour, lime, water, firewood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fabiana Flavia

texts.es: La señorita Fabiana  es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006 ahora se encuentra en su sexta secuencia tiempo durante el cual se ha podido observar que la misma es una persona trabajadora y con ganas de superacion, lo cual se ve reflejado en el negocio que atravez del tiempo ha ido creciendo poco a poco.  La actividad economica que realiza es la venta de articulos varios en su pequeña tienda de barrio ubicada en la calle R. al lado de su domicilio.  Ella vive en csa familiar conjuntamente con su señora madre a la que colabora con los gastos familiares  y tambien junto a ellas vive su hermano.  La sañora Faviana invertira el prestamo en la compra de insumos para su negocio como ser viveres por cantidad, gaseosas y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fabiana has been our client since 2006 and she is now in her sixth sequence. During this time she has proven to be a hard-working person who wants to excell, which is reflected in her business which has grown little by little. She sells different articles from a small local store located in the Calle R. next to her home. She lives in the family house with her mother who she supports with the family expenses, and a brother lives there as well. Mrs. Fabiana will invest the loan in buying products for her business, such as supplies, soft drinks etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in supplies for business.

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es:
La sra. Sandra F. F. tiene 37 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene poco tiempo de haber iniciado con su negocio, este tipo de actividad le genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y su familia.
Sandra se levanta temprano todos los dias a las 4:00am para empezar a producir sus tortillas termina de hacerlas como a las 7 de la mañana para salir a repartirlas y venderlas en diferentes casas y negocios de la ciudad de Choluteca.
ahora ella necesita el credito para comprar materia prima para hacer las tortillas ya que en estos ultimos meses ha tenido un incremento en sus ventas y se queda corta en la venta.
se siente feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo y su calidad de vida esta mejorando.
texts.en:
Sandra F. F. is 37 years old and works making and selling tortillas. She only recently started this business, which generates income to cover the household and family expenses. Sandra gets up early every day at 4:00am to begin making the tortillas, which she finishes around 7 in the morning when she leaves to distribute and sell them in different houses and businesses in the city of Choluteca. Now she needs a loan to purchase raw materials to make the tortilla since she has had an increase in sales the last few months and she has run out of more to sell. She feels happy because her business is growing and her quality of life is improving.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, water, lime, corn flour

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El señor Jorge es una persona que se dedica a la venta de pan molido. Su esposa, la señora Alina Bustamante, es empleada dSe un supermerdado. Ellos viven como inquilinos en la zona de Villa Litoral. Don Jorge compra el pan duro del trabajo de su esposa, ya que cada día sobra y este es reunido y embolsado en sacos y luego se los hace endurar; cuando se acumulan varios sacos de pan duro don Jorge los compra y los lleva a casa para después molerlos en una pequeña máquina moledora. Luego los vende por quintales y arrobas. Don Jorge es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo y su familia. Él solicíta el crédito para la compra de una máquina de moler mas grande por que la que actualmente tiene es una maquina manual y la que comprará es semi automática. De esta manera don Jorge espera aumentar sus ventas y así poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge sells bread crumbs. His wife, Alina Bustamante, works in a supermarket. They are tenants in the Villa Litoral zone. Don Jorge buys the stale bread that is left over from his wife's work each day, which are collected and wrapped in bags and left to harden. Once there are a few bags of hardened bread, Don Jorge buys them and afterwards carries them back home to grind in a small grinding machine. Later, he sells the crumbs by the hundredweight and pound. Don Jorge is a very reponsible person towards his job and his family. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a larger grinding machine since the one he currently has is a manual machine, and the one he intends to buy is semi-automatic. With the new machine, Jorge hopes to increase his sales and be able to make his business grow as well.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a machine to grind stale bread

loans.name: Victoria Jenny

texts.es: la señora viene siendo cliente de Emprender desde el año 2007 donde comenzo trabajando con el Banco de Emprendimiento de nombre el Condor, a medida que fueron transcurriendo los años ella vio la necesidad de sacar un credito individual, en ningun momento ha fallado en ninguno de los pagos de ambos creditos demostrando puntualidad.  La Actividad economica que realiza diariamente es la de venta de comida en un pequeño local ubicado en la Plaza El Condor de la Ciudad de La Paz.  La señora vive con Fernando su esposo y sus dos pequeñas hijas, el esposo colabora con la señora en los gastos del hogar ya que cuenta con un trabajo fijo.  Doña Jenny invertira el dinero del credito en la compra de abarrotes para el negocio y el arreglo del tapizado de las mesas para dar a su negocio un mejor aspecto.
texts.en:
Jenny has been a client of Emprender since 2007, when she began working with an entrepreneurial bank by the name of El Condor. As the years passed she realized she needed to take out an individual loan, and she has never failed to make either of her payments on time, demonstrating punctuality. The economic activity that she engages in daily is selling food at a small place located at the El Condor Plaza in the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband Fernando and her two young daughters. Her husband assists with household expenses since he has a steady job. Jenny will invest the loan in the purchase of groceries for the business and in repairing the upholstery of the seating areas to improve its appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: It will be invested in repairing the upholstery of the seating at the business location

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia DELIA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA, ella vive en el distrito de calca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Calca esta a una hora de la provincia de Cusco. 

La socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de producción y distribución de panes (Panadería). 

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la elaboración de panes y venta de panes. Ella distribuye muy temprano en la mañana a las demás tiendas de la ciudad los panes con ayuda de un empleado. Ya tiene vaR. años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone a su trabajo.  

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de producción y venta de panes, ella quiere comprar más insumos como harina, aceite, azúcar, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the "Virgen Asunta" community bank. She live is the district of Calca, province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. The city of Calca is is one hour from the province of Cusco. This member is 52-years-old, married, and has three children. She has a small business for baking and selling breads (known as a "panadería"). Delia alternates her duties at home with the making and selling of bread. Very early in the morning, she distributes bread to other stores across the city with the help of an employee. She has been in this business for a few years, and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her job. This member requires a loan to be able to increase her working capital for bread production and sales. She would like to buy more ingredients such as flour, oil, sugar, etc. Delia is thankful for the opportunity that this lending method provides, and likewise she agrees to meet her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like flour, oil, sugar, etc. for making bread

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
En la vivienda del señor Miguel Ángel S., está haciendo falta la barda perimetral. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que contratará para hacer la mejora. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo, para realizar su proyecto.
Le preocupa la seguridad de su familia; tiene temor de que pueda pasar algo, en especial a sus dos hijos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carga.
Las personas que aparecen en la imagen son su esposa y sus dos pequeños, él no pudo estar al momento de la visita, su trabajo se lo impidió.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel S. needs to put a fence around his house. But at this time he does not have the necessary means to buy the material or to pay the contractor who would make him the best one. He is requesting a loan because he is worried about the safety of his family, and he fears that something could happen to his two small children. He plans to repay the loan with part of what earns from his job as a truck driver. The people in the picture above are Miguel's wife and his two children. He was not available when the picture was taken since he was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a fence

loans.name: Ruth Elieth

texts.es: Ruth Elieth de 23 años es soltera, trabaja en el MINED de Santo Tomas desde hace 15 años como maestra multigrado en la zona rural, se va los Lunes y regresa los Viernes de cada semana, habita junto su mamá, esta solicitando su primer credito y espera se beneficiada con el fondo kiva para terminar de construir su cocina, pues actualmente la tiene en la salita, tiene comenzado los arranques, solo le falta levantar 3 paredes y ponerle el techo, y con el credito comprara los materiales y hacer el trabajo hasta donde cubra el dinero que se le financie. Expresa que por sus compañeras de trabajo que tambien son clientas de esta institucion se dio cuenta que AFODENIC y KIVA apoya a las personas para que mejoren sus viviendas y las condiciones de vida de su familia por lo que decidio solicitar el financiamiento.  El mayor sueño de Ruth es poder seguir mejorando su casa y poder brindarle comodidad a su mamá y su familia que tenga en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ruth Elieth is 23 years old, single, and has been working in the Santo Tomas MINED for 15 years as a teacher at various grade levels in a rural area. She heads off to work Mondays and comes back on Fridays every week. She lives with her mother. This is her first loan request and hopes to be the beneficiary of the kiva fund to finish building her kitchen. As of now she has it in her small living room. She has initiated the beginnings of a kitchen and only needs to build three more walls and a roof. With the loan she will buy the materials and work until she repays the loan. She states that through her coworkers, who are also clients of this institution, she found out that AFODENIC and KIVA support individuals to improve their standards of living. This is how she decided to request a loan. Ruth’s biggest dream is to continue improving her home and offer her mother and family amenities for their future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen construction

loans.name: Elba Victoria

texts.es: Doña Elba es cliente de la Institucion desde el año 2006 formando parte de los Grupos Solidarios Sumac warmis, Pioneros y del Banco de Emprendimiento Estrellas de San pedro.  Posteriormente ella decidio trabajar el forma individual y de esta forma ya ha trabajado por siete secuencias consecutivas, durante todo este periodo se ha reflejado el empeño que le puso a su actividad ya que se ha podido evidenciar no solo el crecimiento de la cliente , sino tambien el del mismo negocio.   La cliente vive en casa familiar en el que ocupa un departamento de manera conjunta con don Hermogenes, su esposo, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de movilidades, actividad que realiza en distintas ferias como la de la de la 16 de Julio y la de los sabados que se  encuentra ubicada en la Zona de Villa San Antonio; entre ambos se encargan de la manutencion del hogar y de pagar los estudios universitarios de sus dos hijas.  El Proposito del credito es el de comprar fardos de juguetes los que seran comercializados en la feria de la 16 de Julio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elba has been a member of the Institution since 2006 forming a part of the Sumac Unified Women Group, Pioneers and of the Bank of Enterprising Women of San Pedro. Later, she decided to work individually and in this manner she has worked for seven consecutive sequences. During this time she has reflected the persistence that she put into her work and thereby has been able to demonstrate not only her personal growth, but also the growth of her business. She lives in a multi-family house in which she occupies an apartment with her husband Hermogenes who is in the business of buying goods at mobile businesses, an activity he pursues in various street markets such as the one at 16 of July Street and which, on Saturdays, finds him at the Market of Villa San Antonio. Between the two of them they are responsible for maintenance of their home and the university tuition of their two daughters. The purpose of the loan is to purchase bundles of toys to sell at the market at 16 of July Street.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for Christmas

loans.name: Acclamation Plus Group

texts.fr:
Remy A. est dirigeant de la banque communautaire dénommé « Acclamation Plus », composé de 32 micro entrepreneurs déterminés à développer solidairement leurs affaires à partir des microcrédits octroyés par les prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Remy A. 63 ans, est micro entrepreneur depuis 2006. Il est fournisseur d’emballages et des sachets d’eau pure dans son milieu périphérique la plus peuplée au Nord-est de la ville de Kinshasa. Il est mieux connu à cause de ses bons services.  Remy compte avec le prochain prêt, diversifier son affaire en vendant les outils de la menuiserie. Il est divorcé et père de 6 enfants dont leurs ages varient de 14 et 37 ans. Quatre d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Remy A. is a leader of the community bank known as "More Acclamation", composed of 32 micro-entrepreneurs determined to work together to build their businesses from the micro-loans granted by world lenders through Kiva and the IMF HOPE RDC. Remy A. is 63 years old and has been a micro-entrepreneur since 2006. He is a supplier of packages and sachets of pure water in his local area on the more populated Northeast side of the city of Kinshasa. He is well known because of his good service. Remy counts on the next loan to diversify his business with the sale of joinery tools. He is divorced and the father of 6 children, aged between 14 and 37 years. Four of them attend school.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 crates of packages and sachets for water

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Al negocio del señor Miguel Ángel G. le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía de temporada de invierno ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que venda ropa de frío.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercancía, que esta negocio es la fuente de ingreso de el y de su mamá que es una persona ya mayor de edad y está bajo su responsabilidad.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que con está inversión su negocio va a tener más ingreso.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel Gonzalez's business is lacking variety of merchandise for the winter season and his customers are requesting for cold weather clothing. He is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise. This business is the source of income for him and his mother, a senior citizen who is under his responsibility. He plans to pay off the loan with a portion of the earnings from his business since with this loan the business will create larger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Winter Merchandise

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia MARGOT pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA, ella vive en el distrito de calca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Calca esta a una hora de la provincia de Cusco. 

La socia tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene tres hijos dos mujeres y un varón. El mayor estudia en un Instituto superior y los menores estudian en el colegio. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de producción y distribución de panes (Panadería). 

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la elaboración de panes y venta de panes. Ella distribuye muy temprano en la mañana a las demás tiendas de la ciudad los panes con ayuda de un empleado. Ya tiene varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone a su trabajo.  

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de producción y venta de panes, ella quiere comprar más insumos como harina, aceite, azúcar, etc., Para producir panetones y panes especiales para esta navidad.    

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margot belongs to the community bank "Virgen Asunta". She lives in the district of Calca in the province of Urubamba in the region of Cusco. The city of Calca is one hour from the province of Cusco. Margot is 42 years old, is in a common law marriage, and as three children -- two girls and a boy. The oldest studies at the high school level and the younger ones attend primary school. She has a small bakery that makes and distributes bread. She balances running her household with the production and sale of bread. She distributes the bread very early in the morning to the other stores in the city with the help of an employee. She has been running this business for several years and it has been going very well thanks to all of the effort that she has put into her work. Margot needs this loan to increase her business's capital. She wants to buy more ingredients like flour, oil, sugar, etc to make special Christmas breads. She feels appreciative of the opportunity given through this lending service and commits to repaying the loan according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients like flour, oil, sugar, etc for the production of different kinds of breads.

loans.name: Exaucée Plus Group

texts.fr:
Marie Josée 47 ans, dirige un groupe dénommé « Exaucée Plus » constitué de 26 micro entrepreneurs qui se sont solidairement choisis pour obtenir des microcrédits des préteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de renforcer leurs activités.
Marie a comme activité principale, la vente d’habits dans un marché situé dans la partie périphérique au nord de la ville de Kinshasa. Elle aime son affaire et tient à son ambition d’ouvrir un jour une boutique d’habillement. Actuellement, Marie réalise un bénéfice hebdomadaire de $150. Elle a déjà bénéficié 5 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC qu’elle a remboursé correctement. Elle compte avec le prochain crédit acheter les habits recherchés dans son milieu pour accroitre son revenu. Marie est mariée et mère de 3 enfants âgés entre 16 et 23. Deux seulement d’entre vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Mary Josée is 47 years old and a leader of the group known as "Granted More", consisting of 26 micro-entrepreneurs who have chosen to join together to obtain micro-loans from the lenders of the world through Kiva and the IMF HOPE RDC, with the intention of building their businesses. Mary has as her principal activity the sales of clothes in a market location in the suburbs to the north of the city of Kinshasa. She likes her business and holds as her goal to one day open a clothing shop. Currently, Mary realizes a weekly profit of $150. She has already benefitted from 5 loans from IMF HOPE RDC that she repaid well. She will use the next loan to buy clothes in demand in her area to increase her income. Mary is married and the mother of 3 children aged between 16 and 23. Only two of them attend school.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes in demand by her clients for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Super Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Super Plus » est une banque communautaire qui est solidairement composée par 25 membres dont José K. est dirigeante.
José K. 51 ans, vend des sucrés depuis 2005. Elle exerce son activité dans un quartier montagneux localisé au Sud-est de la ville de Kinshasa. Elle a acquit une expérience dans la gestion de son activité qui lui génère un bénéfice de $ 40 par semaine. José compte avec le prêt qu’elle recevra renforcer son capital en achetant 5 casiers de sucrés. Elle est cliente fidèle qui a obtenu 3 crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a tous remboursés. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un jour, un dépôt des boissons à vendre dans son milieu. Elle est veuve et mère d’un seul enfant âgé de 24 ans.
texts.en:
"Super Plus" is a community bank which is established in solidarity by 25 members, including the leader, Josée K., aged 51, who has been selling soft drinks since 2005. She operates in a mountainous district located southwest of the city of Kinshasa. She has acquired management experience from her work, which generates a profit of $40 a week for her. With this loan she’ll receive, she plans to boost her capital by buying five cases of soft drinks. She is a loyal HOPE RDC client who had three loans, and she repaid all of them. Her ambition is to open a beverages outlet one day for making sales in her area. Josée is a widow and the mother of just one child who is 24 years old.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 cases of soft drinks to sell to grow her profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jenny Katerine

texts.es: "La Sra. Jenny, tiene como actividad  la venta de Cds los cuales comercializa en el puesto de su suegra en la Av. Buenos Aires y Stadium, es cliente puntual actualmente esta es su segunda operación bajo este programa. La unidad económica familiar esta compuesta por su esposo, su hijo recién nacido y ella, es una pareja joven el esposo trabaja como empleado asalariado quien también ayuda con la manutención del hogar.La cliente fue recomendada por su suegra ya que la misma es cliente de nuestra institución."
texts.en:
Jenny sells CDs at her mother-in-law's stall located on the streets Av. Buenos Aires and Stadium. She is a punctual client and this is her second operation using this lending program. Jenny's family unit is composed of her, her husband and newborn son. They are a young couple and her husband works as a salaried employee who also helps with the maintenance of the household. Jenny was recommended for this program by her mother-in-law who is also part of this loan institution.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital for business operations (purchase of merchandise)

loans.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.fr:
Sylvain K. K. 43 ans, est président d’un groupe dénommé « Soleil Plus », composé de 28 micro entrepreneurs engagés à recevoir solidairement des prêts octroyés par les prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC, dans le but de renforcer leurs activités.
Sylvain gère un petit atelier de fabrication de petits panneaux solaires et vend de matériels électriques dans une zone la plus peuplée située au Nord-est de la ville de Kinshasa. Vu la demande qui croit, Sylvain compte beaucoup sur le prochain prêt pour lui permettre de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et aussi accroitre son revenu dans le but d’élargir son atelier en ouvrant un autre service la réparation de matériels électriques. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 2 et 10. Deux seulement sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Sylvain K. K., aged 43, is the president of a group named "Soleil Plus", composed of 28 micro-entrepreneurs committed in solidarity to obtaining loans granted by the lenders of the world via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC. The goal of the members is to bolster their businesses. Sylvain manages a small workshop making solar panels, and he sells electrical equipment, in the most populous area northeast of the city of Kinshasa. Given the growing demand, he is counting a lot on the next loan to enable him to meet customer needs and also to grow his revenues. The goal is to expand his shop by opening another place for repairing electrical equipment. He is married and the father of three children, ranging from 2 to 10 years of age. Just two of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical equipment to sell with the goal of boosting his capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Persevérance Plus Group

texts.fr:
La banque communautaire « Persévérance Plus » est un groupe constitué solidairement de 26 membres dont Georgette est dirigeante. Ces micro entrwepreneurs sont déterminés à développer leurs activités avec le soutien financier des prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Georgette K., 55 ans, est dans le monde de micro entreprise depuis 1982. Elle a consacré presque toute sa vie au petit commerce et elle en a acquit une solide expérience. Son affaire actuelle consiste à la vente des épices et de la boisson sucrée. Elle est cliente fidèle qui obtenu 3 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et a tout remboursé à temps. Le prochain prêt lui servira d’acheter des épices pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et acheter 4 casiers de sucré à revendre dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Georgette est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 21 et 42 ans. Deux seulement d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
The community bank "Persévérance Plus" is a group established in solidarity and composed of 26 members, including the leader, Georgette. These micro-entrepreneurs are determined to develop their businesses with the financial support of the lenders of the world via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC. Georgette K., aged 55, has been in the micro-enterprise world since 1982. She has committed nearly her entire life to small businesses, and she has acquired solid experience in it. Her current work involves selling spices and soft drinks. She is a loyal HOPE RDC client, who has obtained a loan three times and repaid them on time. The next loan will be used to buy spices to satisfy the needs of her customers and to buy four cases of soft drinks to sell with the goal of growing her revenues. Georgette is married and the mother of ten children, ranging from 21 to 42 years of age. Just two of them are attending school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spices and four cases of soft drinks to sell for boosting her profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
A L. vivienda D. L. señora Francisca D. L. R. le está haciendo falta lo elaboración D. una cuarto, ya que es madre D. familia y tiene dos hijas adolescentes que necesitan su propio espacio en L. casa.
Desea construir L. recamara D. material ya que es más segura y duradera para ellas. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagar le a L. persona que contratara para realizar L. mejora. 
Doña Francisca trabaja D. limpieza en una casa particular este es le ingreso con el que pagara el préstamo, ya que su esposo el señor Faustino González se encargara D. los gastos familiares con el ingreso D. su negocio D. reparación D. aparatos electrónicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca D. L. R.'s home needs an additional room built so that her two teenaged daughters can have their own space in the house. She would like to build the room out of mortar and brick so that the girls are safe. She is requesting the loan in order to buy the materials and hire the person who will build the addition to the house. Francisca works as a housekeeper and with her income, she will repay the loan. Her husband, Faustino González, will cover the family expenses with the income he receives from his electronic appliance repair business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room in her home

loans.name: Galdina

texts.es:
La señora Galdina S. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo mucho en su negocio, pero por problemas de salud y no pudo seguir atendiéndolo y tuvo que encargarse de le una hija. 
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la barda alrededor de la casa en la planta alta, ya que se encarga de cuidar a sus nietos y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidente. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de los ingresos que genera su esposo el señor Eduardo Escalera de su trabaja en una compañía de trasporte en el departamento de chofer de camión de carga.
texts.en:
Mrs. Galdina S. is grateful for the first loan she received, which helped her business a lot. Unfortunately, she suffered some health problems and could not continue taking care of the business, which is now run by one her daughters. Today, Galdina is asking for a loan to build a railing around the top floor of her house. She takes care of her grandchildren, and she is afraid for their safety. She plans to repay the loan with part of the income her husband, Mr. Eduardo Escalera, earns working as a commercial truck driver employed in a transportation company.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a railing

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Emilio S. les está haciendo falta la elaboración de la barda y el portón al frente de la casa, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar esta mejora.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar la barda y colocar el portón, ya que para el es muy importante, porque es para la seguridad de su familia cuando en no este en casa. 
Ya que es padre de dos hijos de mediana edad y quiere la seguridad para ellos cuando salgan a jugar.
Don Emilio es empleado de un restauran de comida Mexicana en el departamento de mesero, con este ingreso planea pagar el préstamo, ya que los gastos familiares será las propinas que recibe por atender muy bien a solos clientes que consumen en el restauran.
texts.en:
Mr. Emilio S. needs a gate and fence in front of his house; currently, however, he does not have the money to build them. He is therefore requesting a loan to buy the materials and hire a contractor to build the fence and install the gate; this is very important to Emilio because the fence and wall will provide safety to his family when he is not around. Emilio has two young children and he wants them to be protected when they play outside. Emilio works as a waiter for a Mexican food restaurant. With the income from this job, he plans to repay the loan. The family expenses will be covered by the tips he receives for providing excellent customer service at the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a dividing wall and front gate

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel H. es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con un crédito anterior de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarla con sus ingresos que obtiene de empleado de una compañía de construcción en el departamento de encargado de electricista.
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Irma Lindo Gómez, ya el señor Manuel se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel H. is the father of two teenagers who are currently students. With a previous loan from Kiva partner FVP, he has built a room but it is missing the roof. He also wants to build a concrete slab so that his home is stronger and safer. Today, Mr. H. is requesting a loan to finish the room's concrete slab and roof. He plans to pay the loan with his income as manager electrician of a construction company. His dream is to give his children a room of their own and a better life. The person in the photograph is Mr. H.'s wife, Mrs. Irma Lindo Gómez; Mr. H. was at work the day of the site visit.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room's concrete slab and roof

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat A. is 31 years old. She is a very active and passionate woman who started her business in 2002 and has become very experienced and skilled in raising calves. She has applied for a loan of 1606 AZN to expand her flock. She believes this will help her generate greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her three children.

In the future, Matanat plans to buy additional calves to increase her income further. We hope that you will play an important role in her family life because she deeply appreciates the trust and support lenders give her.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Minaya

texts.en:
Minaya S. is 51 years old and single. The difficult circumstances and hardships of her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. 

For about 20 years, Minaya has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, fattening them, and then selling them at local markets. Minaya is a very hardworking woman and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. Thanks to her business she is able to support her parents and help her nephews. 

For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of  1,606 AZN to buy small cattle in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
Elbrus K. is a good father, hard working, and steadfast in his endeavors as a farmer and in raising animals. Thanks to his wife’s assistance, he is able to care for and feed the animals which he later sells at both fairs and marketplaces in nearby towns. Traveling to nearby towns increases his costs, but that is offset by the higher asking price he gets there. 

For this reason, Elbrus and his wife take care to feed them properly in order to bring in more profit. They would now like to increase the number of sheep. In order to buy sheep he needs a loan of 1,606 AZN and promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying it.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Shamaddin

texts.en:
