Shamaddin A. is 49 years old. He is married with six children. Shamaddin has opted to make his life in his land and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time since he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background.  He is now in charge of handing down all that experience to his children. 

Today Shamaddin wishes to increase the number of his cattle. He would like to buy cows with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home. This is why he is requesting a loan of 1,606 AZN. Please extend your solidarity to Shamaddin so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all of his goals.

loans.use: purchase three cows and fodder

loans.name: Luaipoualii

texts.en:
Luaipoualii M. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Gautavai. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Luaipoualii owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Luaipoualii has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luaipoualii joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luaipoualii is requesting a loan from SPBD for the first time. The 1000 WST loan will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. Luaipoualii plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

texts.en:
Nuufou M. is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga. She is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Nuufou owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Nuufou has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nuufou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nuufou is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Nuufou plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Duffy

texts.en:
Duffy F. is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Puleia. She is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Duffy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Duffy has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Duffy joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Duffy is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Duffy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Lila Iraida

texts.es:
La señora Lila Iraida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 03 hijos pequeños, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lila Iraida, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a pesar de las dificultades, que paso en el trascurso de su vida, siguió adelante, la cual esto le dieron muy buenos resultados. Lleva 02 años, dedicandose a este tipo de actividad y hoy en día vende productos de catálogos de línea: Natura y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos, jabones líquidos y en barras, tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Lila Iraida, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Lila Iraida belongs to "Sargento Lores" community bank in the Morales district of San Martín province in the deparment of San Martín. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of 3 young children who depend on her and are currently attending school. Lily Iraida is a persistent, hardworking woman who sells beauty products. Despite the challenges she has faced in the course of her life, she has continued fighting, and things have turned out well for her. She has been selling beauty products for 2 years and currently sells Natura products by catalog order. She is very happy about what she has achieved. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will stock beauty products such as perfume (for women and for men), lotion, compact powder, talcum, liquid and bar soap (for adults and for infants), lipstick, and nailpolish, as well as another display case to show her products. Lily Iraida is one example of many women who have started a business and, with perseverance, achieved their dreams. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and for helping other women grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products.

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.es:
La señora Rolanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de  01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Rolanda, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, que se dedica a la venta de mercería y lleva 10 años en el negocio y a pesar de las dificultades, que paso en el trascurso de su vida, siguió adelante la cual esto le dieron muy buenos resultados. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará mercería para su stock como: desodorantes, kolynos, talcos, espejos, cepillos, papel higiénico, linternas,  lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.

Rolanda, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Rolanda is a member of the Sargento Lores Communal Bank in the Morales district, San Martín province, San Martín province. She is 56, married, and has one child who is still dependent upon her. He goes to school. Rolanda is a fighter and a hard-working woman. She has been in the business of selling merchandise for ten years. In spite of the difficulties that she has had during her life, she continued on, and that gave her very good results. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy merchandise like deodorant, toothpaste, powder, mirrors, brushes, toilet paper, flashlights, lipstick, and nail polish. Rolanda, with her maturity, is an example to follow for many women who start a business. With perseverance they can achieve their dreams. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products

loans.name: Vedith

texts.es:
La señora Vedith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 03 hijos,  02 que aun depende de ella y está estudiando.

Vedith, se dedica a la venta de pollos a la brasa, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, donde sus principales clientes son moradores, vecinos y amigos. Ya es muy conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, realiza sus ventas a partir de las 6:30 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como pollos en javas; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vedith belongs to the Sargento Lores Communal Bank in the Morales district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 44, married, and has three children. Two are still dependent upon her and go to school. Vedith sells grilled chicken in a well equipped place, which is in her own house. She tells us that she has very good daily sales because of the delicious seasoning she gives to her prepared food. Her primary customers are residents, neighbors, and friends. She is very well known, and she is very well received. She currently continues in the same business. She is very happy with the work that she does day to day. She starts selling at 6:30 p.m. She personally takes care of her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy food preparation supplies like crates of chicken, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, vegetables, and also some utensils for her business to give her customers better service. She feels full of life with the desire to get ahead. She has lots of dreams and goals in her life. She is well equipped. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crates of chicken and sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La señora Jacqueline, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre de 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Jacqueline, lleva 15 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Jacqueline, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Jacqueline belongs to the Community Bank "Sargento Lores" in the district of Morales, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is single, 41 years old, and the mother of one son who is still dependent on her.

Jacqueline has been making dresses for 15 years, little by little she has been generating her own income and saving her money, wanting to start up her own dressmaking shop. Having the skill for sewing, there is no doubt that she can do it, and with the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she decided to set up her own business located in her own house. She tells the MFI that her sales are going well, and she works with orders from her customers in advance.

Currently, she continues with her dressmaking, and has a faithful clientele that come to her house daily to place their orders. She personally attends them with the kindness that characterizes her. With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy fabric of different kinds in meters, instruments that she uses as scissors, sewing needles and for the sewing machine, pins, and buttons.

Nowadays, Jacqueline, feels like a very fulfilled woman, with desires to reach and make the rest of her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement) for helping her start her business and also to the many woman who want to grow from a business perspective.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 40 años y no tiene hijos.

Irma, lleva 15 años en el negocio, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos y ahora cuenta con un Salón de Belleza, muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en la parte céntrica de la Ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200.00, comprará productos de belleza para su como: tinte, oxigeno, shampo, cremas, gorros térmicos, tijera, navajas, ganchos, entre otros y así brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Irma, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Irma belongs to the Sargento Lores Communal Bank in the Morales district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 40, single, and does not have children. Irma has been in the business for 15 years. She is a woman who has overcome many difficulties in her life. Her desire to get ahead gave her good results. She currently feels very pleased with the business she runs. She started selling cosmetics, and she now has a very well equipped beauty salon. It is located in the central part of the city. With this loan for 1,200 PEN she will buy beauty products like tint, bleach, shampoo, creams, heating caps, scissors, razors, and hooks, among other things to provide her customers with good service. Irma, with her maturity, is an example to follow for other women who want to start their own business. With perseverance they can achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and for helping other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty materials

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito Banda de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02  hijos, que aun están a cargo de ella y estudian. 

La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le motivó a implementar su propio negocio de Servicio de Internet, se inicio con  S/. 800.00 y día a día fue ganando clientela dado el buen trato que les brinda y el precio cómodo en la hora de servicio de Internet. Actualmente continúa con este negocio pero ya ampliando más cabinas y considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes que generalmente son adolescentes y vecinos del barrio donde vive. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará computadoras, para implementarlo mas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en cables,  para mejorar su cableado de red con canaletas, para dar un buen servicio y seguridad.

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37, is a member of the “Pachacutec II” communal bank which is locaed in the Banda de la Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has two school-age children who are still dependent on her. Motivated by her strength of character and perseverance she was motivated to start her own Internet access business. She began with 800 soles and day by day her customer base grew thanks to the good service and fair per hour rates she charges for her Internet access service. She continues with her business but now with more user booths available considering the demand from her customers who are mostly teenagers and neighbors. With this 1700 sol loan she will buy more computers to equip it still better. Part of the money will be used to buy cables to improve her network thereby giving better service and security. Rosita, as she's refered to affectionately, states that she works very enthusiastically and is grateful for the opportunity to count on financing that help her develop both as a woman and as a small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Beyly

texts.es:
La señora Beyly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 25 años y no tiene hijos.

Beyly, es una mujer joven trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, para probar como le va, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Beyly, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Beyly, 25, is a member of the “Pachacutec II” commual bank which is located in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is single and has no children. Beyly is a hard-working, determined woman. She decided to set up a soft-drink sales business in her home. She administers her sales herself with no boss or schedule. She tells us that she began with a 300 sol investment with which she bought 5 cases of soft-drinks to see how things would go for her. She saw that she did well and that she didn't have enough supply to meet demand, so she invested a bit more. Now, she is well known in her work by her neighbors, family members and friends. With this 1700 sol loan she will buy more stock consisting of a variety of beverges in various sizes, flavors and brands as well as mineral water, both still and sparkling. Beyly very much wants to get ahead in life and is very motivated to see her dreams and goals come to fruition. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help. She is responsible with her repayments and plans to continue to be.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of soft-drinks.

loans.name: Adith

texts.es:
La señora Adith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Barbará II”, Distrito D. la Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 50 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, los dos ya independientes.

Lleva 05 años dedicándose a la venta D. Mercería. Se inicio con un capital D. S/. 700.00 y poco a poco, fue implementando mas su negocio. Es su esposo, quien se encarga D. salir por los pueblos aledaños, a ofrecer sus productos y nos cuenta que hoy en día le esta dando muy buenos resultados. Adith y su esposo, están muy contentos, por el logro que obtuvieron, gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Ya es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donD. vive y sus ventas diarias, quincenales y mensuales, son muy buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará mercería, como: Cuadernos, libros, lápices, lapiceros, mochilas, así como zapatillas en variedad D. tallas, con modelos para damas, caballeros y niños. Adith, es una mujer con muchas ganas D. salir adelante para el bienestar D. su familia y D. ella misma. 

Manifiesta su más gentil agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Adith, 50, is a member of the “Santa Barbará II" communal bank which is located in the Banda D. Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has two children, both of whom are now independent. For the last 5 years she has sold general merchandise. She began with an investment of 700 soles and little by little expanded her business. Her husband is the one who is charged with going to the nearby towns to sell her products and we are told that profits are good these days. She still operates her business from a well-equipped area in her home where she is visited by customers daily. With this 1500 sol loan she will buy merchandise such as: notebooks, books, pencils, mechanical pencils, bookbags, as well as sneakers in various sizes for women, men and children. Adith is a woman who very much wants to get ahead in life and to proviD. for the wellbeing of her family as well as for herself. She is is very grateful to Manuela Ramos Movement for allowing her to grow as a woman and as a businesswoman and for helping other woman who also want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hulley

texts.es:
La señora Hulley, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Barbará II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 25 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun es estudiante y depende de ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de carteras y zapatos, ya que habiendo estudiado cursos de manualidades, no dudo en ejercer ese conocimiento e implementar su propio negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará materiales como: Múranos, corrospa, lentejuelas, plantas de zapatos, cueros y viocueros. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra una vitrina, donde pueda exhibir sus productos, a sus clientes.
  
Hulley, se siente muy joven, tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hulley is a member of the "Santa Barbara II" Community Bank, District Banda de Shilcayo, in the Province of San Martin, city of San Martin. She is married, is 25 years old and is the mother of a son who is a student depends on her financially. Mrs. Hulley's fighting spirit has always defined her and has helped her move forward enough to begin her own business which involves selling handbags and shoes. This business started out from hand crafted items, but gradually became known to her customers and she is doing very well today. She sells her products out of her home and also goes door to door to sell her handbags and shoes. With this loan, Mrs. Hulley will purchase materials such as "Murano" products, sequins, soles of shoes, leather hides, etc, Some of the money will also be invested in buying a cabinet, where she'll be able to showcase her products in a display for her customers. Mrs. Hulley, is very young and content with what she does and thanks the Manuela Ramos Organization for their help with the fulfillment of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará materiales, para realizar sus productos. (to purchase materials in order to make more products - shoes and handbags - to sell)

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Amparo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Solera, tiene 33 años y no tiene hijos.

Amparito, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios y se inició con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 y por iniciativa propia, implemento su pequeño negocio, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, donde vende sus comidas preparadas como juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, y en bebidas como: gaseosas, refrescos y jugos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ms. Amparo belongs to the Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores” in the Morales District of the Province of San Martin – Dept. of San Martin. She is single and 33-years old with no children. Ms. Amparo is what you call a sweetheart; she is committed to selling snacks and with her first loan of S/. 300.00, with great initiative, she started a small business that was well maintained to attend to her clients. Today, she’s still at the same business, where she sells her meals and drinks like: sodas, refreshments and juices. With this loan for S/. 1,000.00 she will buy ingredients for food preparation like, sacks of rice, sugar, chicken and eggs, noodles and oil by the dozen. She’ll also purchase cooking utensils to provide quality service. She feels empowered to be able to continue selling snacks and she is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation of snacks

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita V. is from the village of D'BAN, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is a 57-year-old widow with four adult children. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a retail store selling seafood products like fish and shrimp. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.  Clarita has joined GDMPC in hopes of gaining access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Edelien

texts.en:
Edelien Y. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Edelien is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Edelien owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste, canned goods, bread etc. in the local community. Edelien has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edelien joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edelien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Edelien is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Edelien from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

loans.name: Rose-Ann

texts.en: Rose-ann N. is from the village of Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 28 years old, married, and has two infant children. Rose-ann owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Rose-ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living condition of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Eucebia Del Transito

texts.es: Eucebia del Transito B. R., vive junto a sus dos hijos y una nieta en el municipio de Armenia en Sonsonate. Eucebia  se dedica a elaborar y vender tortillas y pupusas, las cuales las comercializa en su propia casa. Ella posee varios años de dedicarse a este trabajo, el cual le ha permitido seguir adelante junto a su familia. A sus 50 años Eucebia trabaja para contribuir junto a su hija mayor con los gastos del hogar y así mismo le paga los estudios a su hijo menor. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de comprar maíz, arroz y frijoles y de esta manera contar con materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y las pupusas. Eucebia es una persona muy querida y respetada en su colonia, ya que es reconocida como alguien responsable y trabajadora, la cual desea mejorar su negocio y tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Eucebia del Transito B. R., lives with her two children and a granddaughter in the municipality of Armenia in Sonsonate. Eucebia makes and sells tortillas and pupusas (a typical Salvadoran dish made with corn or rice and mixed with pork rind, cheese and beans in a tortilla), that are made in her home. She has several years of experience in this job, and this has allowed her to have a good start in life with her family. Being 50 years old, Eucebia, along with her eldest daughter, works to contribute to the expenses of the home and pay for her youngest sons’ education. She needs a loan to buy more corn, rice, and beans so that with these raw materials she can make the tortillas and pupusas. Eucebia is in her community a very loved and respected person, since she is recognized as a responsible and hardworking woman, who wishes to improve her business and live a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Marina De Jesús

texts.es: Marina D. Jesús P. D. A. D. 37 años D. edad resiD. en Ciudad Arce junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como policía. Ella posee una pupusería y una tortillería, las cuales las elabora y las venD. en su casa. Marina solicita un préstamo, ya que desea invertir más en su negocio, comprando más materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas y tortillas y así mismo mejorar las condiciones del lugar, ya que las personas pueden optar por comprar las pupusas para llevar o comer en el lugar. A pesar que Marina no posee hijos, posee la iniciativa y el deseo D. mejorar su estilo D. vida y la D. su esposo y es por ello que trabaja muy duro para mantener a flote su negocio.
texts.en:
Marina D. Jesús P. D. A. is 37 years old and lives in Ciudad Arce with her husband who is a police officer. She has a pupuseria (a typical Salvadoran dish maD. with corn or rice and mixed with pork rind, cheese and beans in a tortilla) and a tortilleria, which are maD. and sold in her home. Marina needs a loan since she wants to invest in her business by buying more raw materials to make the pupusas and tortillas as well as to better the atmosphere of her business, since people can choose to buy the pupusas to go or eat them in. Despite that Marina does not have children, she has the initiative and wishes to better her life and that of her husband, which is why they work very hard to keep their business active.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make pupusas and tortillas.

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Rosa De María

texts.es: Rosa D. María S. D. L. D. 28 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos todos estudiantes menores D. edad. Rosa posee una venta D. ropa para hombres y mujeres D. todas las edades, así mismo venD. cosméticos y productos D. uso personal. Ella solicita un préstamo para obtener el capital necesario para invertir en la compra D. más productos para su negocio, ya que uno D. los mayores deseos D. Rosa es ver crecer su negocio y D. esta manera percibir más ganancias las cuales beneficien a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa D. María S. D. L. is 28 years old and lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and three children who are all underage students. Rosa owns a sale of men and women’s clothing for all ages and also sells cosmetics and products for personal use. She needs a loan to have the necessary capital to invest in buying more products for her business since one of her biggest wishes is to see her business grow so that she can have more income that will help all of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Aracely del Carmen A. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a su esposo, su madre y tres hijos menores de edad, lo cuales se dedican a estudiar. Aracely, posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa granos básicos, productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de surtir su negocio con muchos más productos los cuales se venden mucho en el lugar, y así de esta manera, contribuir junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar y la familia.
texts.en:
Aracely del Carmen A. is 34 years old and lives in the department of Usulután with her husband, mother, and three underage children who are in school. Aracely has her own business where she sells basic grains, perishable products and basic household goods. She needs a loan to stock her business with more products which are sold a lot in her store, so that she can contribute along with her husband in all the household and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable products and basic household goods.

loans.name: Carlos Rigoberto

texts.es: Carlos Rigoberto G. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante y junto a un hijo el cual se dedica a estudiar. Carlos, es una persona muy responsable, el cual trabaja mucho por el bienestar de su familia, él posee una venta de productos lácteos tales como  crema y queso. El solicita un préstamo con el fin de aumentar la variedad de queso y así mismo comprarlo en mayores cantidades. Debido a que Carlos posee la venta de lácteos en las afueras del mercado municipal de San Miguel, cuenta con muy buena clientela, lo cual lo incentiva a solicitar dicho préstamo y  a seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos Rigoberto G. is 30 years old. He lives in the department of San Miguel with his wife, who works as a shopkeeper, and his son, who is a student. Carlos is a very responsible person. He works a lot to ensure the well being of his family. He sells dairy products like cream and cheese. Carlos is asking for a loan to increase the variety of cheeses he sells as well as the quantity. Carlos sells outside the municipal market of San Miguel and has a very good client base, which has inspired to him ask for this loan and continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying dairy products

loans.name: William Francisco

texts.es: William Francisco C. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Unión junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos menores de edad. El posee una venta de frutas y verduras, las cuales las comercializa de manera ambulante en diferentes lugares de La Libertad. William desea mejorar las ganancias que produce su negocio y es por ello que solicita un préstamo, ya que desea comprar más frutas y verduras. El desea darle lo mejor a su familia, es por ello que trabaja arduamente, puesto que desea brindarles todo lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
William Francisco C. is 34 years old. He lives in the department La Unión with his wife and four young children. He sells fruits and vegetables. He sells them travelling around different areas of La Libertad. William wants to increase his business's revenues, which is why he is asking for a loan. He wants to buy more fruits and vegetables. William wants to give the best to his family. He works arduously, so that he can give the best to his young children.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia L. D. F. D. 49 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, dicho negocio esta ubicado en su lugar D. residencia. Rosa ha trabajador arduamente durante 16 años por mantener su negocio, el cual le ha permitido tener una vida digna junto a su familia, es por ello que solicita un préstamo, ya que desea surtir la tienda con productos los cuales poseen mayor demanda y D. esta manera satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes y así percibir mayores ganancias y ver crecer su negocio el cual le ha permitido durante tanto tiempo contribuir junto a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia L. D. F. is 49 years old. She lives in the department of San Salvador with her husband and two children. She sells perishable foods and basic foodstuff from her home. Rosa has worked arduously for the past 16 years to run her business, which has allowed her to have a dignified life with her family. She is asking for a loan so she can stock her store with products with a high demand and satisfy the needs of her customers. Doing so would mean her business would grow and make more profit, which would allow her to continue helping her husband with household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying perishable items

loans.name: Fibie

texts.en:
Fibie D. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Fibie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fibie owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, milk, soap, toothpaste, and canned goods. Fibie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Fibie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fibie successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Fibie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fibie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

This loan will be the second loan taken out by Zenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions her family.

His wife, Mrs. Haem Korn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Yoen Y. is 55 years old and the father of three children: one is a track driver and the others help with their parents' work. Mr. Yoen Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. This village bank loan is for 17 people who all live in Barkou village in Takeo province.

texts.en:
Evangeline I. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Evangeline is single. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a service-based transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motor cab services to local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide transportation services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is happily married to Dace Jane, who is also his business partner. They run a computer shop in their village of Arellano, beside the University of Saint Louis Tuguegarao City. Most of their customers are teachers and students. They have been engaged in this business for almost five years.

Since technology is becoming more advanced, Romeo is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 from Kiva lenders to buy the necessary materials for them to upgrade their computers. This loan will enable the business to grow and become more stable for the future of their children. Romeo is hoping that his request will be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital to upgrade their computers

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhorn Chham Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn C. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the rice field and make the crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Huong Hoeung, is a construction worker. This couple has two children who are employed in a garment factory.

Mrs. Sokhorn C. is the village bank president. This village bank loan is for 16 people located in Barkou village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Buenafe

texts.en: Buenafe A. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran. She is 57 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Buenafe owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-two years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Buenafe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Buenafe is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Noribel

texts.en:
Noribel I. is from the village of Lower Gamay. She is 28 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child.

Noribel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.  Aside from business income, she receives also monthly remittance from her husband working abroad for not less than 10,000 PHP.

In 2006, Noribel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital.

Noribel is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional construction materials and to pay the labor for house improvement. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to finish her house to have a comfortable shelter for the family to live in.

loans.name: Alice Leila

texts.en:
Alice Leila and her husband are working hard to earn a living for their family in order to overcome the difficulties in life, to support their daily needs, and also to send their children to school. They want them to finish their studies in college so that they will have good jobs some day.

Alice's husband works as a security guard in one of the well-known companies in Bayombong, while Alice manages a small sari-sari store (community based store) in front of their house selling different grocery items. Since their children are in college, she needs to earn a higher income to support their schooling. Therefore, Alice decided to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders. She is requesting PHP15,000.00 to improve her small business. She hopes that her plan will succeed through her patience and sacrifices.

loans.use: Additional capital for improving her sari-sari store

loans.name: Zenia

texts.en:
Zenia is known as “Zeny” in their village in Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Lejao and they are blessed with two children. Despite their economic status, they have a strong faith and determination to give their children a better future by sending them to school. 

In this regard, she and her husband are striving hard to earn a living and to support their educational needs.  Farming is the main source of living. They cultivate their farm by planting rice and vegetables. Furthermore, Zeny sells vegetables in Bayombong Public Market to earn additional income since the income from their farm is seasonal.  As a result of her sacrifices, she can earn a net income of PHP5,000.00 a month, which they use to acquire their needs and finance the schooling of their children. With her interest to earn more, she wants to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders of PHP5,000.00 to be used to buy more vegetables for her to sell.  She expects that with this financial assistance, she can able to improve her business and have an increase in income.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita J. is from the village of Baclay, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four adult children.

Florita owns and operates a business selling charcoal to local community members for housing and business purposes. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 9,600 PHP a month.

In 2008, Florita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.

Florita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory to use as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: Carmencita N. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 57 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Carmencita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Carmencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta and her husband are striving hard to earn a living for the sake of their family and also for the education of their children.  They live happily with their four children in the village of San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They want their children to finish their studies and become successful someday. 

Her husband works as a tricycle driver while Marietta provides Pedicure and Manicure services in their village. She offers her services to her neighbors, especially the employees within their village. Through her patience and sacrifices, she can earn a net income of PHP600.00 a week, which she uses to acquire their daily needs and for the allowances of their children. She wants to offer her services to the nearby villages but she doesn’t have enough capital. Therefore, she applied for loan from KIVA lenders of PHP7,000.00 to be used to acquire the necessary materials for her manicure and pedicure business. She hopes that with this financial assistance, she can earn more income for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for her pedicure and manicure service

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
In order to survive in the midst of crisis, Salvacion and her husband Franky are helping one another earn a living for their family.  They are living in the village of Zamora St. Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.  They have three children and they are doing their best to send them to school and hoping for them to have a successful life in the future.  

Their common source of income is selling peanuts and school supplies and her husband also works as a laborer in their village.  Being industrious parents, they can earn an average income of not less than PHP5,000.00 a month, which they use to acquire their daily needs and finance the schooling of their children. They are planning to purchase additional items to sell but they lack capital.  With this, they decided to borrow a loan from  KIVA lenders for PHP5,000 that they are going to use to acquire more commodities.  Finally, they believe that this will be a great help for them to improve their way of living.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Atyrgul's Group

texts.ru:
Асанбаева Атыргуль – лидер данной группы. Пятидесяти – пятилетняя Атыргуль – мать троих детей. Атыргуль и её муж занимаются домашним хозяйством. Они разводят овец. Они усердно копили свои сбережения, чтобы приобрести скот. В конце им удалось приобрести одну корову. В последующем они размножали скот и по мере необходимости продавали его. Трудно переоценить значение владения живности для Атыргуль и её мужа. Ведь за счёт скота они построили дом, дали детям образование и даже купили квартиру в столице. Они также имеют огород и выращивают там овощи. Атыргуль помимо этого держит коров и продаёт молоко. Только прибыль от молока составляет ежемесячно около двух тысяч семисот сомов. Хотя двадцать лет тому назад, когда они только начали заниматься животноводством, они вложили в покупку коровы всего тысячу сомов. Сейчас корова стоит, чуть ли не в двенадцать раз дороже. Атыргуль с мужем понимают важность того, как им удалось сэкономить время. И тем не менее, они вырастили детей и постарались предоставить им возможность получить образование и свободу выбора  профессии. И дети сделали свой выбор. Они избрали сферу органов правопорядка. Старшему сыну двадцать девять лет, женат. Он работает следователем в милиции. Среднему сыну двадцать семь лет. Он работает в уголовном розыске и пока холост. Младший сын ещё не закончил ВУЗ. Атыргуль хочет приобрести ещё одну дойную корову. Накопление средств займёт много времени, нежели этот кредит, за которым она и обратилась. Атыргуль очень надеется, что она получит его и сможет осуществить задуманное. Она планирует женить остальных двух сыновей и начать увеличивать поголовье скота. 

У Атыргуль три партнёра по группе:

Абдылдаевой Рахат тридцать сем лет. Рахат растит четырёх детей. Муж работает разнорабочим на стройке. Рахат находится дома, смотрит за пятилетним сыном. Но при этом она успевает заниматься животноводством и продавать молоко. Рахат нужен кредит для покупки бычка. 

Бейшенбаевой Розе сорок два года. Вместе с мужем занимаются домашним хозяйством: держат коров овец, а также воспитывают троих детей. Старшей дочери шестнадцать лет, а младшему сыну семь лет. Роза обратилась за кредитом, с целью купить овец для разведения. 

Орозбаковой Динаре тридцать шесть лет. Она мать троих детей. Супруг работает внештатным электриком. Сама Динара занимается розничной торговлей товаров повседневного спроса на дому. Динаре нужен кредит, чтобы закупить товар.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Atyrgul A. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-five and is a mother of three children. Atyrgul and her husband are in the sheep-breeding business. In the beginning they had to save diligently in order to purchase their first livestock. Eventually they were able to buy a cow, and later they started to breed livestock and sell it as necessary. It is difficult to over-estimate the importance of having livestock for Atyrgul and her husband: with the income they earned they were able to build a house, give an education to their children, and even bought an apartment in the capital. Atyrgul and her husband also grow vegetables in their own garden. In addition to the livestock-breeding business, Atyrgul keeps cows and sells milk. Just the monthly profit from the sale of milk is about 2700 soms (local currency). But twenty years ago, when they just started their livestock business, they were able to buy their first cow for only 1000 soms. Nowdays a cow costs almost twelve times as much. Atyrgul and her husband know the value of time. When they raised their children they tried their best to give them an education and the freedom to choose their profession. And the children have made their choice: they decided to go into police work. The eldest son is twenty-nine and is married. He is a police detective. The middle son is twenty-seven and he is not married yet. He works as as a detective as well. The youngest son has not yet finished college. Atyrgul wants to purchase an additional dairy cow. Without a loan it will take her a long time to save up enough money. She really hopes to obtain this loan so she can realize her plans. She would would like to get her two younger sons married and also to increase the size of her flock.

Atyrgul has three partners in her group: Rahat A. is thirty-seven. Rahat is raising four children. Her husband is a construction worker. Rahat stays at home and takes care of her five year-old-son. However, she also finds enough time to tend her livestock and sell milk. Rahat would like to get a loan to purchase a bull. Roza B. is forty-two. She and her husband tend to their sheep and cows. They are raising three children. The eldest daughter is sixteen, and the youngest son is seven. Roza is seeking a loan in order to purchase sheep for breeding. Dinara O. is thirty-six. She is a mother of three children. Her spouse is a self-employed electrician. Dinara has a home-based retail business. She would like to get a loan in order to purchase a stock of goods to sell.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.name: Mohammad Hakim

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is M. Hakim, the son of M. R.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. His family consists of seven members.

He works in a retail shop through which he supports all of his family members. Since he is a part of a big family, and has a lot responsibility for them, he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to repair most of his house parts which were damaged. He wants to repair his house as soon as possible because winter is very near. 

He would like to say that Kiva is an effective process which can support all those who need money around Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Turdihol

texts.ru: Каршиева Турдихол проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 43 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж вместе с сыном, занимаются производством кирпичей. Сама Турдихол занимается выращиванием риса. Она выращивает в основном для продажи, торгует рядом с домом. Кредит просит для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
K. Turdihol lives in the Shahrituz region. She's forty-three years old, married and has three children. Her husband and son manufacture bricks. Turdihol grows rice for a living, selling most of it near her house. She is asking for a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам Давлатов проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 38 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена работает в местном колхозе. Сам Рустам более 12 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:

Rustam has been involved in animal husbandry for over 12 years; he raises and sells livestock. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock. He wants to use the resulting profits to repair his house.

This is Hayatullah, son of A. R.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old and married with six children. He is a hard working man and  owns a small retail shop. 

He would like to take an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy the required supplies for his house construction. He is really glad about the process of obtaining loans in Afghanistan and would like to thank the Kiva lenders very much.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma Z. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Emma is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emma operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services (passenger transport) to local community members. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Emma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

texts.en:
Juralyn A. is from the village of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Juralyn is widowed and has 1 small child. To make a living, Juralyn owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Juralyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Juralyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase a fishing boat. Juralyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Juralyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Farzana Samim Group

texts.en:
This is the Farzana Samim group. It has three members; Farhzana, Rosh Gul and Khalada. They all live in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Farzana is the group leader. She is 50 years old and lives in a family of six members. She wants to take a loan for her husband who has a video selling shop. Farzana’s husband wants to buy all the needed materials for his business and wants to support all of his family members. 

Rosh Gul, the second member of this group, works with her husband. She cleans fruits and packages them, and her husband sells them in his cart in the market. This the only business through which they support a family of five members. 

Khalada’s brother has a tailoring business. He works in order to pay for all the expenses of his family and wants to buy the necessary material for his business.

They all have requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani to expand their businesses. They would like to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for their family businesses

loans.name: Jeselyn

texts.en:

To make a living, Jeselyn owns & operates a livestock-raising business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jeselyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeselyn is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jeselyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

loans.name: Bullen

texts.en:
Bullen A. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and maize flour to sell. Bullen is 27 years old and is married with a husband that is a businessman. She has 8 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren O. is 39 year old single mother who lives with her three children in Uvs province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. All of her three children are secondary school students. Lhagvasuren's family moved to the town from the countryside, where she was a herder, four years ago in search of a better life for her family. She now runs a small rented food store with a few basic items. Her store is located in a good location where there are always many people around. Her store customers usually purchase mutton, beef, and liquid milk that she sells.

In the future, she hopes to expand and renovate the store and eventually purchase this store instead of renting monthly. She says that it was hard to herd livestock in the countryside and she came to the town to seek a better life and education for her children. Lhagvasuren notes that she would like to see her children be well educated and pursue their dreams.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more food items including mutton, beef, and milk for his store.

About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: To purchase more food items including mutton, beef, and milk.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Тошмуратова Ханифа проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 39 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Ханифа более 3 лет занимается выращиванием сельских культур, например пшеницы, лука и т.д. Помимо этого она занимается пашивом одежды. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.

Besides this business, she also sews clothing. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer in order to sow new plants.

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Erdenebileg N. is a 47 year old father of 5 children. He currently lives with his two youngest children, 17 year old daughter and 23 year old son, and his wife in Bayanhongor province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His three oldest children are all university students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The 23 year old son works in a local company and the youngest daughter an 11th grade student at a local high school.

Erdenebileg sells various food products for the locals. He visits local families and herder families by car and sells various basic food products, including rice, sugar, flour, etc. When he is in town, he uses his car as a taxi for locals. He says that his family business pays for his three children's university tuition. His goal is to make sure that all of his children receive a good education without any financial strains.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more food products for his business.

About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: To purchase more food products.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia O. is from the village of West Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 55 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh S. is 29 years old and the father of 2 daughters. He lives with his wife and two daughters in Uvs province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His oldest daughter is 9 years old and a first grade student at a local secondary school, while his other daughter is just 2 years old and stays at home.

Battogtoh drives a cab in the town, which he bought last year. In the winter, he sometimes works in local gold mining - a temporary job that gives some additional income for his family. Since he bought the taxi cab, he has been able to earn some income on a daily basis and contribute to his family's income. He says that he works hard to bring up their daughters and make sure that they get a good education and pursue their dream professions. He is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary motor accessories for his car to get it repaired well.

About XacBank:

It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.name: Badamdorj

texts.en:
Badamdorj J. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Khovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son and daughter, ages 22 and 20, are university students, and his youngest daughter is 16 years old and a high school student.

Badamdorj operates a food cafe with the help of his wife in his town. His cafe specializes in a variety of traditional Mongolian dishes including Buuz (steamed dumplings), Huushuur (fried flour pockets filled with meat) and Lapsha (noodle soup). Badamdorj started his business in 2005 by renting an apartment to open his cafe. He has grown and improved his cafe over the years and today has a consistent operation. His earnings have allowed him to purchase a house for his oldest son and pay the tuition of his youngest two children. For the future, Badamdorj hopes to one day own his own apartment to operate his cafe, and is always looking for other ways to better his business. He says, "I would like to buy a cow and begin producing milk and other dairy products which I can use in my cafe." Badamdorj is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase a cow in order to produce dairy products for use in his cafe.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
J. Davaasuren is 46 years old and lives with her husband and son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son, Gantulga, is 20 years old and a university student. Davaasuren operates a clothes-trading business out of a rented stall in a local market in her town. She runs her business during the day and her husband drives a taxi at night to add to the family's income. Davaasuren started her clothing business in 2003 and has gained much experience over the years. She has used her success to expand her operation and develop many sales channels in her local area. Davaasuren is very hardworking and is always striving to reach her goals. She says, "My main business objective is to supply quality products to the market." She has applied for a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1,400 USD) loan to import clothes from China to sell. 

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January, 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.name: Enkhdalai

texts.en:
J. Enkhdalai is 37 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Mongolia's Khovd province. Their home is a ger, or traditional nomadic tent. All of his children (two sons and two daughters) attend a local secondary school, and his wife is currently serving as governor of their local bagh (or district). Enkhdalai operates a grocery in his town. He previously worked for six years trading animal skins for grocery products in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, before opening his own store in 2006. Enkhdalai has built his shop into a stable operation over the last three years and has many plans for the future. He is working diligently to improve his business and says, "One must work hard to survive in these poor economic times." He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1,400 USD) loan to buy grocery products to sell in his store.
